description:
5 stars for stellar location and early hours. Well, I think they all open around the same time, but love that they are right in FiDi for those early morning FiDi workers if you ever are trying to go to work extra early. 

Location is a little bit small, so I find it super difficult to find a spot to sit at if I ever come in the afternoon, but if you wait around for 5-10 minutes stuff always opens up. I also love love love the pastries (they get their kouign amanns and croissants from oakland!). 

I really wish they sold oat milk though. I love oat milk.
author: Jeanette S.

description:
My go-to Philz before I head over to work! Right between the Embarcadero and Montgomery stations, this is a popular Philz location. There always seems to be a line out the door, but it does move at a decent pace. They also accept mobile order, which has been super convenient for me. I'd make my order, get off at Embarcadero, walk over, pick up my drink, head over toward Montgomery. 

Though with the convenience of mobile order, I feel that it's a bit rushed based on the taste of the coffee compared to ordering in person and waiting to mobile order and pick up. The mobile order at this location tends to be very popular if you compare the times of pick up at other Philz. I try to place an order before 8:20AM, and the pick-up time is 9AM, whereas other Philz is 8:30AM. Learned my lesson - order it before I hit that tunnel after West Oakland. 

I love getting the mint mojito (creamy cream, medium/light sugar) on hot days as it really cools you down. When I'm too cheap to spend that extra $1 on the mint mojito drink, I'll either get the ecstatic iced coffee (such a wonderful blend) or their Julie's Ultimate (hints of vanilla, berry, toast). Their dark roasts are all wonderful - a standard Jacob's Wonderbar for a more traditional dark roast, Tantalizing Turkish if you want that herby/cardamom flavor, Aromatic Arabic if you want that dark dark dark flavor. Yumness! You can customize your coffee by the creams (creamer, soy, vanilla soy, whole, 2%, etc) and sweetness (sugar, honey, artificial sweeteners, etc). 

The baristas here are super nice, and I'd order in person every morning if I was willing to get up just a bit earlier allotting some time just for the Philz coffee, but unfortunately, I rather sleep in an extra 15-20 mins so I mostly mobile order.
author: Rita W.

description:
Philz Coffee is a chain coffee house based in SF. Despite it being a chain coffeehouse, everyone I know who's been to SF tells me that if I'm into coffee, I need to visit Philz.

I made my way to this location one morning before work started - just to try it! The lines were out the door, but yet people were still lining up. This was a good sign. They specialize in drip coffee, meaning they make your drink on the spot when you order. You order with the barista and then slide down the counter to pay. They'll call out your order when it's ready.

Despite the fact that I prefer my coffee with no sugar and just a splash of cream, I opted for the traditional light and sweet Mint Mojito. It was so good. The coffee was so smooth and the subtle hint of mint really made the drink pop.

I liked it so much that I found another Philz close to my friend's house where we were staying and made us stop there before our road trip to Monterey.

The baristas were super nice and I thoroughly enjoyed my first Philz Coffee experience.
author: Michelle T.

description: The mint mojito iced coffee is where it's at. I downloaded the Philz coffee app and ordered my drink with ease. The app lets you order your drink, pay, and choose what time you want to pick it up. I only had to walk up to find my name on the cup and go. The mint mojito iced coffee is literally what it sounds like. It was refreshing with a slight hint of coffee. This location is on the bottom level outside of an office building. Have a seat outside and people watch as you sip on your drink.
author: Lanha T.

description:
This is the market street edition of Philz known for it's great coffee outside seating and long lines.

Parking? On market street in the financial district? Nope. Not gonna happen. The embarcadero garage is the closest mass parking option, and baby it ain't cheap. Like a lot of things in SF you are best served getting here some way that does not involve driving. Luckily there are literally dozens of other options including the cheap effective and popular trolley line.

There is not a lot of inside space-this thing is almost a walk up kiosk. There are some window counter seating, and a few loungy chairs with tables just to the left as you get in the front door. There are however a dozen or so table/chair combos outside, which only really works if the weather co operates. When it's sunny (pro tip-don't count on that before noon at the earliest) that makes a good choice, otherwise......well, there is another Philz about two-three blocks away (the thirst for coffee is real in the city yo) which will while still having a line, it's typically less of one.

It's not uncommon for the peak morning office coffee rush to be ten to twenty people deep. Yes, the coffee is that good. They don't do specialty coffees-non latte's, espresso etc (I could swear that they used to-both myself and my partner-who normally doesn't drink coffee-distinctly remember a exceptionally good philz mocha, so either that was a seasonal item/short term thing only, or we are both wrong which is possible) yet the pourover blends on offer are sheer caffeine delight. You've more then twenty choices grouped into light, medium, dark and tea blends and it's hard to go wrong. 

Do note that you've got to stand in line (the longer one) to order a coffee direct from the barista, then stand in line again to pay (this line will be by the pastry display case). The second line will be where you place any food orders as well. Philz typically has the best avocado toast in town, and the sweet options are solid as well.  Also know that the barista will be adding any cream or sweetener you may be wanting so if you desire those speak up when ordering. While there is always a line, it isn't always long, and it does tend to move fast. Philz is optimized for volume sales.

So the four stars are for the perfect pour overs, supreme baristas and delicious toasts not for anything else about this spot.
author: Steven W.

description:
First time trying Philz during my visit to SF. I love all things mint, coffee, chocolate....so definitely knew I wanted the mint mojito coffee. I ordered that one half sweetened. It was still absolutely delicious! I drank it faster than I would have liked since I was doing some work there for a couple of hours.
It is a bit pricey for what it is though. +$1 for this and I got the smallest size, but still came out to just about $5.

The line was pretty crazy. I'm not surprised since this location is in FiDi. It definitely gave me time to figure out what I want since there were so many options and to kind of figure out what the ordering and paying system is. 
It's different and unique compared to what I'm used to.

FOR THE FIRST TIMERS, a step-by-step guide and narrative by yours truly:

- Wait in line and figure out what you want. 
Good luck if you don't like mint and defaulted like be because there are so many interesting names and ones that sound delicious. 
It's so hectic and loud that you almost feel bad asking too many questions.

- If you make eye contact with one of the baristas and she's free, walk up to her (or him) and basically shout your order cause it's that loud. 

- Then walk to the right to the cash register and wait in line to pay. You tell them what you got. 
It's a system of trust.

- Then wait around and watch the hustle and bustle of making your drink. Good luck getting a seat.

- Wait till either your name and/or order is called and you'll see the barista looking around and yelling while still trying to swiftly make the other orders.

- Pick up your order, flash a smile and thank you, and bustle on out. Enjoy~

RANDOM:
I did notice something. The creatives are all about sitting at the window, opening a notebook, and then just people watching for hours. No writing, nothing. Then packing up and leaving. Interesting -sips coffee- Next time, I'm joining in. :)
author: Sarah N.

description:
I probably am the last person on the planet to come here, but I'm so happy to say Philz definitely lived up to the hype! Decided to take ol' Philz for a spin today and am seriously impressed by my experience! Located in the heart of SF's FiDi ( the millennial term for Financial District) - it's a happening little joint with food options as well including my fave Avocado Toast. Yum!

I asked the friendly hipster at the counter what her recommendation was between the Chai & another tea called Istanbul Treat, she said the latter was her favorite. Be prepared to also get asked what level of sweetness and how much cream you like. They definitely cater to everyone's personal preferences, so you can be assured you get exactly what you order! 

Liked the playful candor between the hard working employees as well. You can see the teamwork and service with a smile which is clearly very important here! 

Back to our orders. My friend ordered the iced Mocha Tesora which was to DIE for ... perfect balance of chocolate with the quality coffee beans they use. Quite delicious, think I'll order that next time! Don't you just hate it when your friend's order ends up being better than yours? 

Not to take away from my Istanbul Treat tea. It was such a smooth, delicate blend of spice and cream and the honey paired nicely! 

Outdoor seating is also available, so you can observe her business men & women clad in work attire and a pair of sneaks as they hurriedly rush from A to B. 

Ladies & Gents, you're looking at a Philz convert!
author: Jeanie B.

description:
Ashlee, the store lead, reached out after my initial review.  We messaged and I asked for a recommendation on straight coffee and told her I would update review.  

She recommended both the Philtered Soul and Jacobs Wonderbar. 

I tried Philtered Soul; a medium roast with flavor profiles of hazelnut with chocolate undertones. 

Definitely get the hazelnut aroma right away and very pervasive with each sip.  

My colleagues tried Jacob's Wonderbar and also sipped my coffee. They enjoyed their cup but came to the same conclusion about mine; the hazelnut was very overpowering. 

I didn't finish the cup (as you can tell in the picture).  The coffee was oily and the hazelnut taste dominated any chocolate undertones and actual coffee taste.  It was like drinking artificially flavored coffee and not for me. 

I like that they serve one cup at a time and love that the store leaders are concerned about the customer experience and delivering a quality product.  It was very cool of Ashlee to reach out!

I guess I just haven't found the one cup for me yet.
author: Cindy G.

description:
I came to Philz Coffee at the recommendation of a friend who's lived in San Francisco for years now.  He told me that I had to try the Mint Mojito Iced Coffee.  Alrighty.

Philz Coffee happened to be on my way to the Ferry Building, so I made a quick stop.  I entered the coffee shop and it was surprisingly spacious and very clean.  Best part, there was no line unlike the other Philz Coffee shop just down the street (that one's closer to the Ferry Building and the line was crazy!).  The girl at the counter was very nice and friendly.  She quickly took my order and in a matter of minutes my drink was ready.  During that time I was able to browse their food options and they had some avocado toast, pastries, & some other goodies, but I decided to save my appetite for the Ferry Building.

Now, I'm not normally an iced coffee kinda girl.  I usually get a frappuccino or a hot coffee, but I figured I'll expand my horizons and my friend was really adamant that I try it.  Thank goodness I listened because the Mint Mojito was delicious!  Definitely different than your usual iced coffee and it was pretty refreshing I must say.  I would get it again and I highly recommend it!  Yummmm.
author: Maria P.

description:
Came in last week not knowing wtf to order and fortunately I landed in line with the nicest baristas/coffee makers/employees (idk what their official title is). One seemed to be a trainee and the other a possible supervisor/coworker helping out with my big order. They quickly school me on how they didn't have an expresso machine and anything latte was not possible. BUT they offered alternatives that sufficed (in my opinion) which was very considerate of her to suggest. 

On the other hand, when I went to pay I didn't know the names of those "substitutes" and the cashier seemed to be irked about it. She proceeded to coffeesplain to me, "I feel people should do research before coming here." Didn't now how to react at that moment but in retrospect I don't feel as a 1st time customer or even a regular customer has to be an expert on a company's product. I should be able to go to an establishment and not know everything about your company. Just sayin!

Regardless, of that past experience; my overall experience was excellent and so was my experience today. Again, the person helping me was super nice and when she asked me if I wanted my mint mojito "sweet and creamy", I wasn't sure so she said she would remake it if I didn't like how it tasted. That was really nice of her to offer and she didn't have to remake it because it was deliciouso!
author: Glenn A.

description: Really enjoyed my drink! The mint keeps coming into your mouth which is a bit annoying but I loved the refreshing taste. Also I think the caffeine content was extra high Bc I couldn't sleep that night
author: Komal S.

description: I love Philz! This one gets pretty busy on weekdays because it's near FiDi, but the wait is never painfully long. This location feels a little smaller than the one further north on Market. There's a lot of outdoor seating and maybe 3-4 small tables inside for working/meeting. Music is on the louder side. Despite that, wifi is fast and coffee is great.
author: Thu P.

description:
Mint Mojito!

It is beautiful and good! Coffee is fresh and cool with mint! Worth trying!
author: Zhijian J.

description:
Favorites drinks are Philtered Soul and Mint Mojito iced coffee.

This location almost always has a long line but the wait isn't so bad when grabbing a coffee with a friend or coworker. I come to this location regularly around 2 pm

Once you learn to get used to the chaos that ensues at Philz you'll always get a good cup of coffee with a friendly experience.

The Baristas are very accommodating and always ask you to taste your coffee before you go. I almost never ask for adjustments, but I'm not that picky and I usually get drinks without sugar and light on the cream.
author: Danny L.

description: Mint mojito! Wow! If you like mint, get this! So refreshing and drinkable. I asked for mine light on the sugar because I don't like things too sweet, and it was just right. Really wish they would open one of these in NYC!
author: Stephanie K.

description:
Everyone loves Philz - seriously. If you don't love the classic mint mojito, there are so many other options and one is bound to appease your tastebuds.

I usually go with the mint mojito but I was feeling wild so I ordered the ecstatic. I think I actually liked it more than my usual!

Customer service here is always great. My friend ordered a dairy substitute with his drink and the barista forgot - she ended up giving the first drink to him on the house as an apology for the inconvenience.

Any time I'm back in SF, Philz is an easy place to drop by and cross off the list!
author: Amy C.

description:
The pride of SF (for coffee) is Philz Coffee? 
A must try if you're a coffee buff. There's several locations, even a food/coffee truck. I found this one on Market. 

A lot of people talked about the Mint Mojito and it didn't disappoint. The food and pastries were just okay. Service is friendly, but no where to sit. All the seats are taken by people on their laptops all day. Washrooms are locked. You have to ask for the passcode.
author: Vincent H.

description:
This is one of my go-to places in Fi-Di when I decide to go out for coffee rather than drinking coffee at the office. This location is super convenient since it's on Market St - really easy to get to on foot or by BART/MUNI. It certainly gets busy at times with long lines out the door, but I don't feel like I've ever had to wait for an unreasonable amount of time. 

Despite the busy-ness, most of the staff I've talked to are friendly and take some time to chat and/or offer suggestions, which is nice. I don't usually drink sweet coffee but I'm partial to the iced gingersnap coffee here, as well as the mocha tesora (medium blend).
author: Bianca C.

description: My fifteen minute coffee run somehow turned into like an hour long wait... But otherwise their minto mojito iced coffee was delicious.
author: Justine C.

description:
I don't want Philz to lose their soul unlike the other huge mega chain evil empire coffee store that I'm not going to mention ***STARBUCKS*** as they continue to expand their brand from the small and humble beginnings in the Mission.

Phil Jaber has built this brand organically from the ground up (pun intended) since 2002 and has been consistent throughout the whole process. He's got over 30 stores in the Bay Area and as far south as LA and San Diego that he has got a cult-like following. Having met Phil, a local celebrity, he gives an aura of a cool grandpa with a Midas Touch and a twinkle in their eye. 

For the longest time (it seems that way) the closest location from my work was the one near AT&T Park. I didn't mind stopping there before going to work, but traffic before and during a game made it quite a challenge. 

When I discovered he finally opened one location in the Financial District, I got giddy and my inner caffeine addict in me couldn't wait to strut the 10 minute walk into arabica nirvana. Even though Philz is known locally, not all locals have tried their coffee and it brings me great pleasure to introduce them to their Iced Mint Mojito. 

Sh*t, I consider myself a pusher of Philz to my family and co-workers who have not yet tasted Phil's wonderful blends that are masterpieces in the coffee business. And staying with the local theme, he uses a lot of local artists with local subjects to display their artworks and creations in every store. 

As you expand and grow, keep to your roots and don't ever change, Phil. Don't ever change. You're a one cool cat with a twinkle in their eye.
author: John G.

description:
My experience here was better than another one, the staff was approachable and friendly for the most part. 

I ordered a philharmonic coffee and a cinnamon roll. Both are okay, the roll is quite good when warmed. For some reason I find the coffee to be lacking, maybe it's the type of mixture you get, and it doesn't seem to be the most flavorful.
author: Spencer H.

description: It's Philz. Who are we kidding...  This place rocks. Great seating outside. Small inside but who cares. This place never misses.
author: Scot M.

description: I love Philz coffee and I've been to many locations. I've always received friendly service. I will usually give 5 stars, but this location's customer service is dismal. I went here with my wife on a pleasant Sunday morning.  There was no one in line so we went up to the counter. The barista said, "I'll call you when I'm ready. " in an annoyed tone. We apologized and she didn't acknowledge us after that.  We waited until a different worker called us and she was about as charming as a wet sock on a cold day. No smiles, just monotone questions and answers. We asked for a bag of coffee to be ground and the cashier snobbishly asked what grind level we wanted. I understand it's cool to be a brooding artist working at a coffee shop, but is a little common courtesy too much to ask??
author: Jason J.

description:
Has an infectious morning energy. Think of your elementary school homeroom period before classes with friends milling about. Now picture the adult version, where young professionals catch up before heading off to work. 

There's a certain buzz in the air, probably induced by the millions of mg of caffeine flowing constantly. At this particular location, order in advance or be prepared to wait. However just like other Philz, they take time and care for your drink. Worth it!
author: Kyle S.

description: All the coffee drinkers rave about Philz and they are always busy. I used to go here quite often when I worked in the area. I like their food and hot chocolate.
author: Sunil R.

description: Nice location, Philz has good coffee, clean and good lighting. But please get all-gender bathrooms, and some gluten free pastries. Thanks!
author: Kate H.

description:
First time at this location, but finding out Philz now has a mobile app? Amazing!

Pros (mobile ordering):
-Quick to set up an account and order on the go (I ordered while I was towards the end of the massive order line. Placed my order in the app and stepped to the mobile pick up area
-Mobile pick up area: on the far left of the shop (next to the hallway before the restrooms). Drinks are placed alphabetically (first name)
-App gives you an assigned pick up time for your drink before you finalize paying 
-App tells you which barista is making your drink, has a countdown for when your drink should be ready, and when it should be ready for pick up 

Cons (mobile ordering):
-Countdown of your drink order is the expected time it should be ready (based on the time you were assigned). Not based on whether or not the barista is making it (or saw/remembered the order )
-Baristas were only announcing drinks for large orders (3 cups or more), or for people who inquired if their drink was ready. Otherwise you had to be vigilant about seeing your name/cup
-Overheard people say their wait time was about 10-25 minutes long (a con for those needing to get to work or with time constraints)

Not so amazing was that my order was forgotten about. I didn't realize until I asked the barista, 2 minutes after my scheduled pickup time, and she told me as much. 

No apology for the oversight was given, but to her credit she was quick to brew my drink once they realized the error. 

I'm not sure how long the app has been live, but I'd recommend not putting expected times drinks are to be finished (to limit any potentially annoyed customers and to take off stress on the employees about time restrictions). 

Minus one star for the forgotten drink and another star since I ended up late for the oversight. BUT otherwise this Philz was similar to their other locations: large, well staffed, and the occasional confused first timer not knowing how the order/pay process goes 

I'd still go back, but maybe give myself a 20 minute buffer.
author: Caroline T.

description:
One of the very few places open on Sunday I the financial district.
I really like the medium blend coffee options they have. Try philarmonic if you like some spice in your coffee.

Not many vegan food options (they only have donuts for vegans)
author: Sevda G.

description: Hands down my favorite coffee location in San Francisco. You have to try the Mint Mojito ice coffee. It's a particular treat for myself. The handcrafted one coffee cup at a time. It's elixir of the gods. I got Philz Bagel. It's everything bagels with cream cheese, tomato, and  English cucumber.
author: Diem N.

description: Pun alert, I am buzzed to write this review.  Yes, I am that psyched about it.  I love the concept, all pour over all day.  I had an iced-ecstatic and drank every last drop.  Though the line was about 50-people long when I showed up, things moved along well enough (about 10 minutes) and I was able to get up and order.  Like the vibe, great cup straight-up no sweetener or ice, and fast service.  Worth the price, get it!
author: Charlie C.

description: I have only tried their mojito coffee but that alone made the trip worth it. The staff were friendly and the coffee came out pretty quickly. But this location does close early on sundays!
author: Sarah C.

description: The BEST pour over coffee ever! Service is ehhh and the employees aren't the first but it's great coffee and there is a reason why there is a line out the door all the time. This location has great tables that allow you to enjoy your coffee outside and people watch. Go here and enjoy it!
author: Bethany M.

description: The go to is the mint mojito coffee. Love the sweet and creamy coffee here. Extra creamy and extra mints alsoooo
author: Joey N.

description:
So centrally located, so thank you to this Philz being right on Market. 

DRINK: My go to is probably that Mint Mojito (I know, so basic, right?), but honestly, it's best with half cream and half sugar to still get that full experience, but not be so intense. I would highly recommend speaking to your barista as they can definitely guide you through the menu to ensure you have a coffee of your liking. 

SERVICE: Top notch as always with Philz with an attentive barista who will make sure your drink is to your liking. 

Again, Philz smashes it home and makes it great for all customers!
author: Albert H.

description: The line in the morning is loooong but yo! don't be dissuaded because other reviewers are right and it moves real fast. Staff here was efficient and friendly. Review is more about this location because duh the drinks were great.
author: Daisy R.

description:
Pretty decent sized Philz located in the fidi area right before the Ferry Building. Some bar seating and plenty of outdoor seating. Same as all the other Philz as you stand in line for your made to order coffee/tea and then you pay. They offer food items here too. I saw an avocado toast and what not. They have free water here which is a plus! Two unisex bathrooms with a totally must needed passcode as even with the passcode we noted some sketchy business. The outdoor seating is a plenty with an open space for you to people watch. Since its in SF and fidi/downtown location there will be some homeless friends wondering around. Overall, it was a nice break from the hectic downtown area but yea it can be a bit a sketch.

We've only been here on the weekend. It is not too crazy. We never had to wait too long. Not sure what its like during the weekday.
author: Sarah C.

description: Absolutely perfect!! And the protein bowl is amaaaazing!! Irie vibe, jammin to slightly stoopid and rebelution! Perfect start.
author: Alie H.

description: Typically what gets me through the day and is much needed all the time. Delicious and yummy and I always come back for more. My order is an iced mint mojito w/ almond milk and lightly sweetened.
author: Cecile ..

description:
~ YAYYYYY ITS MY 450TH YELP REVIEW PHILZ COFFEE AT THE SAN FRANCISCO DOWNTOWN AREA ~

On my very last time I drank Coffee from Philz Coffee was a year ago when I took a ride at Cal Trans and headed down to the City Of Sunnyvale on my day off from work!!! And now on February 21ST 2017 which was 1 day ago... I finally got another chance by trying this Philz Coffee at the San Francisco Downtown Area and of course it was my day off from work as well!!! When I first found this Philz Coffee at the Downtown Area Of San Francisco!!! While walking inside for my very 1st time at this Philz Coffee Shop just like the one at Downtown Sunnyvale it was crowded!!! 

But the one at the San Francisco Downtown Area was a lot more crowded than the one went to a year ago at the Downtown Sunnyvale Area!!! The Philz Coffee that I drank at that Downtown Sunnyvale area was a Small Iced Coffee... And now a year later while I found this Philz Coffee of the San Francisco Downtown Area!!! And the Philz Coffee that I decided to drink this time was the New Matthattan Style Coffee and finishing it all it tasted really good and kept me awake through out the whole day!!! If I get another chance I definitely would wanna go back to Philz Coffee and try another Coffee style at Philz Coffee!!!
author: William B.

description:
I haven't met anyone who doesn't like Philz Coffee. Since opening in the early 2000s, this small coffee chain has become quite popular and synonymous with the San Francisco Bay Area. With over a dozen locations in the city, my first experience with Philz was several years ago in the Castro. Not long ago, we stopped by this location in the Financial District and the coffee we got hit the spot.

This location is busy with both tourists and workers. The cafe is centrally located to the Ferry Building and the Embarcadero, South of Market, Union Square, Chinatown, and the FiDi.

The cafe is located on ground level, at the bottom of a First Republic Bank office building. The storefront facade is all glass and both the inside and outside look nice and modern. Indoor and outdoor seating are available. Sitting outside is pleasant as there are many tables and chairs spread out across a spacious brick courtyard, away from the streets. Inside, the cafe feels warm, comfortable, and inviting. Access to the restrooms is restricted by a passcode.

Philz specializes in individually drip-brewed cups of coffee. During our visit, the coffee menu had over 20 blends to choose from including dark, medium, and light roasts as well as multiple decaf options. A small cup cost $3.50, large $4.50, and by the pound, $18 per pound. In addition, they offered other drinks like iced coffee, hot chocolate, and nearly 10 kinds of tea at similar pricing per cup.

One thing I like about Philz menu is even though there are a lot of options, they keep it simple. You don't have to be a coffee hipster to enjoy this place. Each coffee (or tea) on the menu is described in three helpful, aromatic words or less. For example, the medium roast Philtered Soul is described with the words hazelnut, cocoa, and syrup. The dark roast decaf Swiss Water Peru: cedar, earthy, smokey.

I tried the dark roast, full body, Jacob's Wonderbar prepared "Philz Way," medium sweet with cream. The drink was ready in a few minutes and its description (chocolate, nuts, clove) was spot-on. One of the baristas told us Jacob's Wonderbar is one of the company's most popular dark blends and I can see why. It's a very good, quality cup of coffee.

Good service. I'd definitely come back.
author: Daniel B.

description: Always on point! Ambrosia is excellent! Atmosphere is upbeat. Line was quick this morning.
author: Kayli T.

description:
I was in our San Francisco office for a meeting and a colleague of mine suggested that we go grab coffee at the super popular Philz.  I am a pretty picky coffee drinker and I rarely go to a coffee chain, such as Starbucks, to get coffee unless I am traveling.  It was hard to decline her invitation since she was so enthused about it; so I skeptically obliged.

I must say, I did enjoy the coffee at Philz.  Unlike most of the dominant chains, you can always pick the flavor you like at Philz.  That was my biggest pet peeve with Starbucks - you never know what blends they are serving when you walk in. 

The hand pouring of the hot water to brew the coffee seemed more for showmanship than any real practical purpose.  The blends of coffee are quite excellent with distinctive flavors that would probably meet the preferences of most savvy coffee connoisseurs.

I tried Julie's Ultimate for my first visit since I prefer darker blends.  It had a nice toasty vanilla flavor on top of slight hint of roasted nuts.  This is a blend that may be habit forming for me.  I can see why Philz is so popular.
author: Louis C.

description:
Philz is the best! 

My go to: Sooo Good Warm with medium cream and sugar. 

Delicious! 

If there is a blend you'd like, they can do custom cups of all beans they offer. 

If you see Hazelnut, it's worth trying but hard to find! 

Remember to order ahead if you're in a hurry via the OrderAhead app.
author: Michelle K.

description:
As someone with gold status at Starbucks (does that REALLY MATTER anymore though?) and really likes the consistency (generally) found at a Starbucks, going to Philz required a bit of a learning curve. Luckily I was there shockingly early and my fumbling at ordering didn't cause a hassle (I hope!).

Since I've only ever ordered Philz from their truck I didn't know how they distinguish themselves from other coffee shops from a service perspective (it's easy to tell how distinctive Philz is from a quality of product perspective). At least the location I walked into, which I assume is similar and generally  consistent across the brand, there is a big counter with a few baristas. You order your drink from them and then shuffle over to the register to pay. This seems intuitive but for some reason I definitely hit the struggle bus a little by going straight to the register (probably because that's where the food was and I wanted food as well).

So, my first faux pas was not ordering from a barista. Then, I didn't realize the extreme care Philz baristas take with drinks means you basically have your own barista for your time and experience. You watch your barista make your drink and they had it over to you. If two people order the exact same drink and one comes out first- make sure it was your original barista. That was my second blunder here. My third mistake was not tasting my coffee before putting a lid on it. Apparently you're supposed to do a taste test and let the barista know how you feel about your drink. Whoops. Luckily I got a black coffee so it wasn't a big deal.

I also got super confused about my food order. I didn't know when to expect it or where to pick it up. Eventually I figured I would trust Philz to guide me... and it came through! Somehow the person making my food knew my full name and called it out when it was ready. I have to assume it was from my credit card or a previous visit (again, to the truck) somehow?

Anyway, my own incompetencies aside here... the coffee was/is fantastic. Hands down, fantastic. The avocado egg toast was wonderfully delightful and absolutely made me understand why other millennials have such a hard time deciding between it and buying a house. I'd likely go with the toast more often than not personally.

Next time I go to a store location I'll know better. But, there will definitely be a next time, or basically and every time when I see Philz.
author: John T.

description: Philz is delicious. I really like the chai latte that they make special. Just make sure to explicitly say you want a latte.
author: Caroline M.

description: New morning routine: Philz across the street from my new office. Like all Philz, super friendly staff. Line moves quickly. Excellent pastries to compliment their wide range of coffees available. Large Tesora, please!
author: Michael M.

description:
The kind service set this apart as a 4 star review for me. The barista who helped us was kind and patient despite the long line and my inexperience with their menu. She suggested the mint mojito coffee and explained how it was prepared. She listened to my questions and gave friendly answers.

I wasn't particularly impressed with the mint mojito coffee. It was certainly different. Maybe I expected something spectacular from what I thought was one of their most popular items. I liked it overall and I will try again I am sure. Maybe I should have just stuck to a coffee for my first visit. That would have been easier to compare against the many many other coffee shops in San Francisco.
author: John W.

description:
I've been trying to learn from others' experiences and branch out of my comfort zone at work, so networking sesh #2!

I got the iced mint mojito that everyone raves about. Ugh, I can't do this afternoon coffee thing anymore-- I feel suuuuuper jittery right now, but for everyone who has regular coffee tolerance, I think the caffeine level is probably normal. I got extra cream in my drink and I think it may have diluted out the taste of mint-- I'd have loved for it to be a bit more minty! My coffee definitely tastes more like cream with a hint of mint than coffee. I did appreciate the fresh sprig of mint on the drink though. Also gotta drink it fast before the ice dilutes your drink!

Adequate amount of seating on the inside, outdoor seating for when it's warm. The ordering is a bit confusing as you order at one spot (spot A), pay in another spot across the store (spot B, have to tell them what you got again), and then go back to spot A to pay.
author: Nicole H.

description:
Pro tip: this philz is usually pretty crowded (no seats inside) during business hours in the work week, but is amazingly low key during weekends when tourists all flock to the ferry building philz instead. 

I've noticed that the baristas are not as consistent as the other philz I've been to but they're 11/10 friendly and awesome. 4 stars because I might get a really mediocre, underdeveloped cup of coffee but still feel good about it.

Oh philz you sly fox you
author: Robin Y.

description:
Highly efficient coffee makers here, and apparently the best time to get a coffee is just before noon.  The quality is comparable to other philz, and the beans are as always excellent.

TryCaviar (who bought Order Ahead) runs the pickup coffee bar, and they seem to be frequently idle.  Thankfully they've optimized the workers here to pick up the normal walk-in line as well
author: Matt U.

description:
From their mint mojito to their Philtered Soul to their Tesora to their Tantalizing Turkish...everything is amazing. I usually rotate between these 4, lately been feeling the Turkish more often.

My local Philz is in San Jose, so I'm used to drinks from them, but I would say the baristas at this Philz made my drink just as creamy and good.
author: Nishi S.

description: I normally don't drink coffee or particularly like the taste of coffee, but my best friend has been raving about how amazing this place is and how their drinks are the best, so I shared some of her drink today. I have to say, it was probably the best coffee drink I have ever tasted. She ordered the mint mojito ($4.50 for a small, $5.50 for a large), which is an iced coffee that is sweet, creamy, and deliciously minty. They add in ample mint leaves to the foam on top which give a really nice refreshing flavor to the flavor of the coffee. Even for someone who doesn't normally drink coffee, I liked the taste of this drink!
author: Amy C.

description: Philz Coffee is brewed "one cup at a time." The staff is very friendly and will wait for you to try your coffee to make sure you are pleased, even though lines are out the door. Now that's customer service! I got the Gingersnap hot and wanted it extra hot, but they can't do that, but it's understandable since it is literally is like a French press style with water going over the coffee grains. I thought the gingersnap was really good! They are famous for their Mint Mojito and that is very tasty and unique, too. A small is $4.50 and was a very good cup and well worth it! I also got a twice baked Almond Croissant and it was delicious and fresh. Would highly recommend this Philz if you want something special in the morning...or really, anytime of day!
author: Jessica G.

description: I came here with a group of friends who had been before.  I actually only drink decaf, but it was incredible.   I will have to go back.
author: William R.

description: Came on a Sunday morning. Out of meat breakfast burritos, all toasts, and all bagels but cinnamon raisin. Asked for iced coffee got a hot coffee. Gave it an extra star because the pastries we did order were good (but small for the price we paid).
author: Jordan P.

description:
Came with a friend here. Good coffee. Service is ok.

The cold coffees are really nice!
author: Vipul S.

description: Their specialty is the coffee drinks, not the beans. Get the iced coffee mojito. For gourmet coffee, there are better options out there.
author: Ivan S.

description: Got the mint mojito iced coffee on the recommendation of a friend. Was it good? Yes, but I believe it is overly hyped. The mint surprisingly works with the coffee - it gives it a refreshing taste. Would I get it again? Sure, but wasn't blown away.
author: Jeanna S.

description: An unique coffee experience, with custom brews. The person behind the counter was so helpful since it was my first visit. She made recommendations off of flavors I tend to like. The coffee was really good and you can't beat customer centered service. Will be back next time I am in the bay.
author: Mary N.

description:
Worth the wait! Made one cup at a time. It's super tasty and unique. There are so many varieties of coffee that it can be hard to decide. 

If you're in a hurry they do have order ahead so you can skip the wait.
author: Kaley K.

description: If you want healthy and natural coffee go to Philz coffee! This place is very good and well located in the center of San Francisco. The room is not very large, but you can find a comfortable place for yourself. Stunning views of downtown!!! Lots of fresh food and drinks. Here you can have a great time with friends.l very like this Philz Coffee:)
author: Sofya K.

description: Every time we come to the bay we always stop in here I really wish that down on the Central Coast we had this coffee shop typically we get the Jamaican blue but this time we tried the mint mojito  it is iced and a must if you're stopping here. All of the options are non-espresso-based blends of different types of coffee to offer a well rounded flavor to your palette the flavors are all natural and you're not even needed to be accompanied by syrups.
author: Shannon S.

description: Whenever I come up to San Francisco I make sure  to have my morning cup of Coffee at Philz. LOVE Love the Iced Mint Mojito beverage. I live In Orange County, California so there are a few locations here in so cal. But its still about an hour away from me. So unfortunately I don't get Phil often.
author: Crystal N.

description:
This Philz is larger than the one in Folsom, I believe they have 1 maybe 2 more baristas here. Don't be fooled, the larger the coffee shop the more coffee drinkers. I get here at around 8:15 and can't receive my order until about 8:30. 

Nonetheless what is life without a nice philtered soul to wake you up for work :)
author: Alex S.

description:
Calling all coffee lovers in the area!

If you have yet to try Philz Coffee, then you are missing out on a whole lot of goodies! Not only is the coffee delicious, but the workers here have a "can-do" attitude which wakes me up even before my coffee! 

I wanna say that everything on the menu is great! Personally I enjoy the Mint Mojito and Ginger Snap Ice Coffee, because I can enjoy it in the before, during and even after work, especially after a busy and long day. 

So, If you have yet to try it out then what are you waiting for?! Even if it is just a sip, you NEED to try it!
author: Benson M.

description:
Pretty much can't compare with this location Philz got everything you need to enjoy a high-energy day. 
Music
Customer service 
Ambiance 
Outlets to stay charged up
All around up beat which helps me personally in staying focused​ and it's somehow a bit inspiring. Big thumbs up y'all!
author: Curtis F.

description: Two words: mint mojito! Having just moved to the city, I heard a lot about Philz and so I was excited to try it, specifically for the Mint Mojito. Thankfully, they have almond milk so I subbed the regular milk with that. It's delicious - just lightly sweet unlike the overly sugary Starbucks drinks. I also taste the Ginger Snap which was good, too. Oddly, they don't do lattes at all but who needs 'em when you've got so many other delicious options? I also split a cinnamon bun with my mom which was delicious, as well. Highly recommended!
author: Pooja C.

description:
My wife and I were in town for a weekend getaway. We were told this is a  must-go in the City. It is. 

Walked in and were greeted right away and a friendly face. The barista was quick to offer suggestions (get the Mint Mojito if you've never been before) and took our order directly. After ringing up at the cashier, we waiting inside... nice location, very comfortable. 

Once we got our food, we went outside and picked a spot in the immediate courtyard area of the building and enjoyed our food while watching downtown life go by around us. 

SO MUCH COOLER than Starbucks or Peets!
author: B D.

description: Never had Philz Coffee before this visit and boy was I missing out! The ordering process was so confusing at first (order at the counter with one person then get into another line to pay), but the coffee is soooo good! I usually hate coffee and mainly drink it for the caffeine but the iced mint mojito totally changed the game. It is sweet and creamy and has a prominent mint flavor that I love. Will definitely be going to Philz when I get back home to SoCal. I was wondering what all the hype was about but now I know.
author: Lina P.

description:
Mint Mojito Iced Coffee!

Finally tried this place and am so happy I did. The staff was really helpful and were happy to adjust their drinks to accommodate. There was no line, plenty of seating available when I went and loved my drink.
author: Shelley C.

description:
Hmm, I think I have an addiction.  Tesora, black...thats my fix.  I always come here for the hot coffee, although their iced varieties are pretty delicious.  

The line can be long, the staff is very efficient and moves it pretty quickly.  10 am, 3 pm, those are the worst times to go.   Between lunch and 3 it is pretty slow.
author: Veasna H.

description: Iced mint mojito & Iced Mocha Tesoro is the way to go for all you folks who enjoy coffee without the black coffee taste. Also opt for sweet & creamy if you're really looking for a really easy to drink concoction that hits you with caffeine soon after sipped.
author: Carissa G.

description: Philz Coffee definitely lives up to the hype. All the baristas were super friendly and knowledgeable (especially when they could tell I had ZERO idea on what to order). Me and two friends each ordered something different and it was all equally delicious! If you're a big tea drinker like I am, try the Yerb Mate iced tea! It was delicious!
author: jessica r.

description:
Why 5 stars? Because my one true love is more convenient than ever.

   ---   ---   ---

I think I would officially call Philz my favorite coffee shop of all-time. Every time I'm in the Bay Area, I try to go out of my way to make an appearance at one of their locations. I've written reviews for a few different locations at this point, so normally I'd probably skip writing this one, but this one has a special meaning for me. I no longer have to go (as far) out of my way! 

Working a few times a year at nearby Yelp HQ meant that nearest Philz was an Uber ride away... but no more! This is only a few blocks from where we normally stay, and ensures that Philz will always be a part of my mornings on my trips to the mothership.

As is the case with all other locations - the coffee is phenomenal, the people are friendly and the bagels are delicious. Philz, if you want to expand outside of the Bay Area, I'd offer you my first born.
author: Brett N.

description: As all the other philz locations, they are great, friendly staff, cool people and nice environment.
author: Jay G.

description:
Across from Bank of America & Starbucks.
Come here for excellence coffee but be aware the long line out the door never ends. It can get pretty intimidating. One recommendation, download Cavair, you can order you coffee ahead of time and pick up, or just order from your phone while you wait! No need to stand in that line. Lots of seating outside and inside, but they do go fash during the rush- 3pm particularly.
author: Azizi A.

description:
Like most people, I come here because not only is the coffee great, but the experience is always positive. My primary reason for heading into Philz is caffeine, but the reason I would travel further to get to Philz than to another spot is definitely THE PEOPLE. Everyone who I've been served by here has been super friendly, happy, positive, and makes me feel like I'm a friend who's dropped by to visit. 
Making every cup just for you, this location handles a LOT of traffic every day, but manages to do it without feeling hectic or bustling. It's like a Bay Area time warp - the way it used to be all over the greater Bay Area, with people just being laid back and friendly, not worried about everyone else's business, non-judgmental, and chill.
I'll be coming back to this location whenever I'm in San Francisco because the experience is consistently pleasant. Hopefully you'll agree!
author: Erik K.

description: So, I finally tried Philz and the famous Mint Mojito that everyone is talking about and here's my verdict: it ain't for me! I was really excited and when I tried it, I was like, "meh, it's alright!" Anyway, I've been coming here everyday of the work week since the COO of our company likes his Dancing Water fix so I've been trying different drinks each time I come. So far, I like their Mocha Tesora (both hot & iced) with almond milk and today, I just tried their Philtered Soul w/ almond milk and that shit was delicious! Every staff here I probably already encountered and each of them are very friendly. Everyone moves at a fast pace and they surely keep the line moving but thankfully I haven't been there to the point that it's that long. I'm gonna keep working through the entire menu until I decide which one would be my go-to drink.
author: Candice J.

description: Awesome coffee. Awesome vibe. The barista was dope, really knows his coffee, but the cashier was a little short with us. Like thanks for the pronounciation correction, Mojito is apparently prounounced "moe-juy-toe". Couldn't tell if she was kidding. Coffee was awesome tho.
author: Anna H.

description:
As a coffee lover, Philz has been on the top of my list but it wasn't until I was on my way to Super Bowl City that I finally got to try this place. I saw their big bright sign and it was definitely a sign for me to try it. There was no line at all which was surprising to me considering others have said this place gets packed. Probably because everybody was more concerned about getting into Super Bowl City. 

I knew I wanted to try their mint mojito iced coffee but I glanced at the menu and they have such a wide selection. I like that they separate the different roasts they have. I was tempted to try one of their blondes but opted for what seemed safe. 

The whole process of ordering, paying, and receiving my drink was kind of unorganized. You go to one of the baristas on bar and tell them what you want, then go to the side and pay, and just kinda hover around the bar and wait. They don't ask for your name or give you a number so it seems that anybody can just come and snatch your drink thinking it's theirs. Also they speak so low when they're calling out drinks. 

Nonetheless, I enjoyed my nearly $6 iced coffee (kinda hurt me because of the price but oh well). The mint mojito wasn't too sweet but nice and creamy and the mint flavor was subtle enough to taste but not too overwhelming. I was instantly energized and downed that coffee so fast. 

Philz was all I expected it to be except for that weird ordering process. I'll be back soon Philz!!!
author: Melissa M.

description:
Perfect.

Not really much else to say.

When I see a tourist looking at the crazy long afternoon lines I know there is no way they can fathom the exceptional perfection that is The Philz! You've never had anything like this.

I'm very worried this coffee chain is growing way too fast. Please don't mess this up. Every cup is always perfect. I really hope it stays that way.

I find it very refreshing that the baristas get to play their own music. Thanks Phil!
author: Justin S.

description: Great Philz. Location is small and doesn't have a lot of seating. Not ideal for doing work, but perfectly fine for grabbing a quick one to go.
author: Billy S.

description:
Use "ORDER AHEAD" app to place your order and skip the lines. 

This Philz is in the financial district, so expect lots of dressed up people waiting in line to get their caffeine fix. I was under strict time pressure to hit as many places as I could in SF in 10 hours -- I didn't want to wait in line so my sister used the "Order Ahead" app to place our order 15 minutes before we arrived and our drinks were ready and waiting for us when we got there.

The reason the line is so long is because some people don't know the answers to the dozen or so questions they ask. You need to know all the basics before you get to the front of the line! Hot or cold? Size. Milk? What kind of milk? Sweet? What kind of sweet? Real or fake? Which fake sweet? Once you've passed that test, you need to pay. Then you need to wait for your made to order drink. 

If you're waiting in a long line reading this, go open that "Order Ahead" app and order your drink now. You'll probably save some time. While you're at it, you can also order your dinner and have it delivered for tonight. #lifeHack
author: Lori I.

description: Never been to a bad Philz. Service was great and fast.  Order was accurate. Some food takes a long time however.
author: George T.

description:
Philz Coffee! great spot on market street and with friendly staff! I came here twice already, with two different female staff's recommendation on coffee and it was DELICIOUS! I usually get the mint mojito (ice coffee) but in the morning, I'd like to start with something "hot." I've been recommended the Jacob's, first on the list of "dark coffee" and it was really really good, even though the coffee is $4.50, it's definitely delicious. The 2nd visit consisted of Julie's Ultimate, also a good choice, but my top pick is still Jacobs for now.
The staff is really polite and friendly, so if you're new, ask them for recommendation and if you don't entirely enjoy it on the first sip, let them know and they'll offer to make a new one for you.
author: Hao B.

description: My total favorite coffee chain in the bay areas. My go to is the mint mojito. I think i got 3 within a one week visit. Great for anytime of the day.
author: David Dat T.

description:
This place has a line 30+ deep every weekday morning.  Philz has found a way to make pour over assembly line style and can really move some customers through the place.  As long as you don't get behind a few people ordering for their whole office the line moves pretty good.

The coffee varieties offered is really exceptional.  There are only a handful of places that I can think of offering that many options.  It did take me a few tries to find a favorite but all of those I did try were very good.  

Even though the line moves fast it may be the longest line for coffee in town and it does deter me form going at times.
author: Scott M.

description:
This Philz location is one of the newer franchises around. At first I stayed away because I knew how popular and crowded it would be, being in a hot part of the Financial District. Then my friend suggested that we meet up here. I fell in love instantly, and this is by far one of my favorite Philz locations in the Bay Area. 

I love that there's plenty of outdoor patio seating and some indoor seating areas for all types of weather. The atmosphere promotes casual conversation with an old friend or work colleague. Everything about this store is super organized and clean and contributes greatly to the Financial District community. I'll be back many more times! The store manager is pretty cool too.
author: Stefanie C.

description: My daughter recommended the mint mojito and I was not disappointed. I also chose a bakery item, it was a cinnamon twisted stick but I'm not sure of the official name; it was delicious! The service was friendly and efficient. There were seats available during our visit and it was a clean and inviting environment. I recommend with enthusiasm!
author: Cheryl K.

description: Super fun, quirky place. I love that they individually brew every coffee- makes such a difference! They have really fun blends and names, and both hot and cold options. The service was great. You order your coffee on the left, go and pay, and then they call you when your freshly brewed delicious beverage is ready. I'm so glad I finally tried this place!
author: Mari K.

description:
I'm so sad I only really discovered Philz Coffee in my last week of being in San Francisco. Even so, I went out of my way to go back! The first time I went in with colleagues, I mistakenly ordered a latte assuming it's like Starbucks or even Peet's. I was delighted to hear that they don't even serve latte's and instead serve their own variety of speciality coffees!

I normally dislike speciality coffees at Starbucks and other chain coffee shops as they are often just crammed with sugar. The baristas at Philz are great though and made an effort to make the best coffee for me - cream but no sugar. I definitely recommend Ginger iced coffee and also the Ecstatic iced coffee (both incredible!).
author: Michael C.

description:
This location is a huge spot. Rent must be expensive.

This spot is a very convenient location serving FiDi and SoMa. 
Lines can get pretty long.
Prices are the same as all the other philz.

I stick with the estatic or the mint mojito...
Here's a little off the menu tip for caffeine fiends: They have an XL size that isn't advertised. The XL size uses the black lids.

Anyway, this location has a pick up counter specifically for OrderAhead if you order through your app / the website for pickup. Skip the line and pick up your coffee. 

I'm glad this location opened. I'll be frequenting quite often!
author: Kaje Y.

description: Came back today and had a much better experience. Vicky made my coffee and was very nice and adjusted my drink to my liking.
author: Stephanie F.

description:
I would have given five star to this coffee shop but due to inching up of prices I won't  u see the best different flavours here. Coffee I tasted are terrific n impressed coffees are Tesoro and mint hot coffee and cappuccino all are good  and rich in aroma and soft.

Recently Ethiopia decade which is also fine to taste. In this fidi center it's always crowded at afternoons also .

Starbucks : for the ones who want light roasted coffe Starbucks suits

Peets : fro the ones who loves to have bold n roasted coffee Peets suits

The coffe bean : for the one who loves to have perfect taste of coffee coffee bean suits

 Blue bottle :  for the one who loves to have perfect blend of beans blue bottle is best but pricy .

Philz: for a medium roast n creamy kind of flavour phill is always best
author: Sandeep R.

description:
This new Philz location is about a block from the building I work in, and every time I've passed it since it opened the line was out the door and down said block. However, midweek at around 5 PM I managed to walk in and there was no line whatsoever, so keep that in mind if you're in the area when everyone else is going home and Philz is an hour from closing.

The interior is really nice, very airy with high ceilings and modern lighting, loud music, and nice people behind the counter. This was my first time at any Philz, ever, so I went with the drink I hear about the most: the mint mojito. 

I ordered it without any alterations or specifications made, just the way they make it, and like it a lot. The fresh mint really makes a difference, and I thought it was the perfect amount of sweetness, especially for me, who doesn't put sugar in her coffee or tea. 

Would I make a return trip? Yes, more than likely at the same time I did the first time because this wasn't worth the hour wait everyone else is waiting. Would I come back every day? No, because it was good, but not four dollars a day for a small, good. Solid first time experience with Philz.
author: Angela M.

description:
Ever since coming back from Dollywood in April, I have decided to pursue my new dream of becoming a Southern gospel singer with my back-up trio, the Coffeemates, and my own theater in Branson, Missouri. That way, my wax likeness could be preserved as an animatronic mannequin just like they have in Dollywood's Southern Gospel Hall of Fame. I would have my plasticine doppelganger sing this Cristy Lane classic on a constant loop...

One cup at a time, sweet Jesus
That's all I'm asking from Philz. 
Just give me Silken Splendor 
To sip every day what I want to drink. 
Prima Cosa's gone, sweet Jesus 
And Blue Bottle may never be mine. 
Phil, help me today, pour one my way 
One cup at a time

Blasphemer you dare call me, do you? Well, Philz is like my church, The Church of the Overcaffeinated Saints, you decaffeinated heathen, and I've had the hedonistic pleasure of patronizing most of their locations in the city. That's why I got down on my knees and thanked the Big P for opening up a new branch just steps away from my office building (photo: http://bit.ly/1C0fEfD). Philzaphiles like me have been waiting for weeks wondering why the barista training was taking so long before opening to the panting public. Because of the free giveaway on their opening day, I stayed away, but the queue was barely out the front door yesterday.

Despite the cloudburst of rain, it was a tolerable level of moisture for me to fulfill my personal obsession with the Silken Splendor blend. It was pretty well organized once inside with a very cheerful woman directing us to the next available barista. A large Silken Splendor, please, no sugar, light on the cream (photo: http://bit.ly/1FUdjn5). There is a bench for the endless wait (photo: http://bit.ly/1L2V46t) and a small sitting area toward the left as you walk in (photo: http://bit.ly/1GgMQ6q). It is a smaller space than most Philz outlets, but I don't care since I am more likely to bring it back to the office to enjoy anyway. Philz has landed in the FiDi finally. That would be one small coffee bean for man, one giant Tesora for mankind.
 
One cup at a time, sweet Jesus
That's all I'm asking from Philz. 
Just give me Silken Splendor 
To sip every day what I want to drink. 
Prima Cosa's gone, sweet Jesus 
And Blue Bottle may never be mine. 
Phil, help me today, pour one my way 
One cup at a time

Oh..here's Cristy's far less caffeinated version: http://bit.ly/1B4zHP7

COFFEE - 5 stars...smooth richness or rich smoothness second to none
AMBIANCE - 4 stars...not as comfy-cozy as other Philz outlets but it is the FiDi after all
SERVICE - 4 stars...almost as smooth as the Silken Splendor
TOTAL - 5 stars....Philz is in da house
author: Ed U.

description: When in sf, drink your coffee like the locals. Or the tourists that try to be local. So many flavors to choose from! I went with "whatever is the most popular medium roast" aka the Tesora. It was very flavorful and still pretty bold. I could've gone with something lighter, but it tasted fine just the same. I loved how it's brewed right in front of you too. They did mess up my order (medium instead of the large I got) oh well.
author: Clara S.

description: Coffee is very good, however it is great quality. Customer service is great and the baked goods are yummy. I thought the breakfast burritos were just ok. I will go back for coffee and vegan doughnuts! Try the doughnuts with the Philz coffee added they are sooo yummy!
author: Raina D.

description:
I've been to this Philz location more than any other, mostly because it's in downtown, and just a block from the embarcadero bart station.

Everytime I'm here, there is usually a short wait. In the late morning the line gets long, and will be out the door. 

One time, I was working there and an angry, psychotic, homeless man walked in, started causing a scene. He was yelling at customers and cussing at the employees. At most places, any employer would be tempted to call security to kick a guy like that out. Instead, I saw two of the baristas stop working to de-escalate the situation. I was impressed with their patience, as they sat down with him and let him vent out his frustrations. Apparently he was just fed up with the lack of SF public bathrooms. They were polite, and even offered him some coffee. 

Most recently, I went in there wearing a warriors shirt and they hooked it up with a free drink.

This place is legit!
author: Juan C.

description: What can I say, I love Philz Coffee. I can never complain about the mint mojito, the aesthetic inside, and the super duper nice baristas. I don't even mind the long lines during rush hour because I know that the coffee is going to be that good.
author: Bidisa M.

description:
Struggling being 4 and 5 stars. Philz used to be more consistent in quality.  The front street location---where I now go most often--- is very good, but not as consistent as I remember from Berry St, my former regular Philz spot. But, really, they are all very good. Try the Aromatic Arabic if you like dark roast, no cream, no sugar. 

Bring your own travel mug, not just because it's more environmentally friendly, but also because the lids on the Philz to-go cups just don't fit well, causing spillage.
author: Ron S.

description:
I LOVE Philz--they truly converted me from a regular latte drinker to loving a solid sweet and creamy drip coffee. Ask for a Velvet Lady (Silken Splendor + Julie's Ultimate + Chai Spices, Sweet and Creamy) and you won't be disappointed.

Only critique is I wish they'd allow tipping on credit cards--bring cash for tips!
author: Tricia R.

description:
This is a great new location.  Congrats, Philz!  I love your iced coffee.  We went in for their extra soft opening for which it was incorrectly advertised that they were serving free coffee.  We saw it advertised and they did not know what we were talking about when we asked about it.  They wanted proof.  Initial management was rather rude and so were the servers, so that impression is sort of stuck in my head.  

We talked to management further, got our free coffee that day and came back for more free coffee the next day, which was their official soft opening on which they were actually giving out free coffee until a designated time.  

My first customer service experience is sort of marred from the initial rudeness, but I can get over that with a few more free coffees.  Please feel free to contact me in all seriousness.
author: Maile N.

description: This location is great. It is somewhat small. I love all Philz Coffee locations just the same. Came here for my hot chocolate. I enjoyed it. My people come here that are dress up. That's because this location is in the financial district. This is the financial district location. This place is much better than the Bluebottle coffee shop that is nearby Philz Coffee rocks.
author: Isaac H.

description: Had to try philz on my first trip to SF, and this place was packed. The venue was medium sized, but the line was out the door. However, it moved relatively fast. I tried the mint mojito based on a friend's recommendation. It was light and refreshing. Would come again if only it was available on the east coast ;).
author: Tiffany W.

description: This is the worst location for their signature coffee-Mint Mojito. I feel like because of the amount of customers which makes the barista rushing for every coffee they make. it's either so bland, so bitter or so something something. I only have 2 out of 20 perfect mint mojitos here. The reason I keep coming back because it's right next to my office and I am addicted to Mint Mojito.
author: Chloe N.

description:
Rejoice for another Philz location even closer to where I work! 

Rejoice for friendly baristas at 8am in the morning! 

Rejoice for coffee (and you really can't go wrong with any of them, although my preferences are the mojito, Turkish, Greater Alarm, and the drink I just imbibed this morning, Sooo Good) that kicks the ass of a Frappucino every minute of every hour of every day of every week of every month, every year. 

And most importantly, rejoice for this huge caffeine rush that's fueling me this morning. 

Welcome to FiDi! Although does this mean that the Philz truck on Pine and Sansome will go away? :(...
author: Viet N.

description:
I make no bones 'bout loving this place. 
#PhilzCoffee is hands-down the best coffee on the west coast. 
This particular location is set to open soon (I had the opportunity to meet members of the new team and "test-drive" their coffee-making skills). 

As expected - it was an #amazing ride! 

This particular location is a stones throw from my office (set to open in a few days) and I'm loving it! 

My suggestion: on a cool SF morning, when you're strolling past the location that was once a "University of Phoenix" - stop, and treat yourself to a #PhilteredSoul #PhilzWay you'll love you for doing it and you'll thank me for suggesting it!
author: Nick S.

description:
Favorites drinks are Philtered Soul and Mint Mojito iced coffee.

This location almost always has a long line but the wait isn't so bad when grabbing a coffee with a friend or coworker. I come to this location regularly around 2 pm

Once you learn to get used to the chaos that ensues at Philz you'll always get a good cup of coffee with a friendly experience.

The Baristas are very accommodating and always ask you to taste your coffee before you go. I almost never ask for adjustments, but I'm not that picky and I usually get drinks without sugar and light on the cream.
author: Candice C.

description:
Philz is really popular in SF.  I can see why.  They have good quality coffee and a good system for ordering coffee.  

They have a lot of different blends/roasts and they are well described on their menu.  

It's an alternative to Starbucks and offers something a little different.  I'm not a huge coffee drinker but I tried it out and could imagine it being people's preferred chain coffee store in the SF area.
author: Matt K.

description:
All right, I guess I'm finally a convert now.

I had some time to kill so I stopped by Philz Coffee in the Financial District. Their menu is pretty much entirely black coffee, no mochas or cappucinos for you! 

As a mostly decaf drinker, I was pleased to see that they had more than one decaf coffee for your choosing here. A lot of other coffee shops have 0-1 decaf coffees. 

I opted for the Ethiopian (decaf) coffee, with a small hint of cream and sugar. The resulting drink was actually really great. The barista got some foam at the top of the coffee, which is pretty unusual for black coffee. The chocolate-ness and the slight sweetness made it taste really good. Look Ma, very little milk and the drink still tasted great!

I'd come back again, sure. I don't really drink that much coffee but when I do, I'll fondly think of Philz.
author: Danielle C.

description:
Lines are way too long and service is way too slow. I just wanted coffee and ended up standing in line for 30 minutes. 

Somehow people who ordered after me for their orders before me. Good job Philz. Earned yourself a 1 star review
author: Matthew L.

description: The coffee is fine, but the ordering experience gets me so confused and flustered. Why on earth did they think it was a good idea to set up a cafe like this?
author: Sonya M.

description:
We don't have this chain in our area and were up for trying something new.

They have a different approach, refreshing, from the Starbucks experience. The service felt more personal and that they were truly making a cup of coffee for you.
The flavor was great and the store's atmosphere was inviting and spacious.

Try it out if you're in the area.
author: Tony H.

description: So what does a diehard Starbucks coffee junkie think about Philz Coffee?  First, let's start with the eye-popper -- the price.  A large coffee at Philz is $4.50 where it's "only" $2.65 at Starbucks.  If you're into coffee volume, a large-size Philz cup is equivalent to a "grande" size (medium) cup at Starbucks.  OK. So the price puts you in the first class cabin.  Is it really worth the price?  So, second, how's the taste?  It's not as bitter as Starbucks.  Philz adds sugar and creamer as part of their service.  Nice!  Lastly, what's the final word on Philz?  My mind is not ready to cough up $4.50 for a cup of coffee.  Yeah, it's a great cup of brew.  But, on a daily basis, $4.50 is close to the cost for a meal. Unless one cup of Philz coffee gives me all of my daily vitamin requirements and a hug each morning, it's back to Starbucks.
author: Anthony K.

description:
Finally made my way to the new Philz in FiDi! Long lines in the mornings were off-putting to me, but when I decided to swing by with a couple coworkers for a late afternoon pick-me-up. Even though we arrived around 4PM on a Tuesday, there was still a line! However, it was only to the door and moved very quickly. The service was speedy and friendly--thanks Devin for explaining what the "house way" (more creamy and sweet) and "Phil's way" (medium creamy and sweet) was.

I got my usual mint mojito coffee which was the perfect cool drink during this SF heat wave. I notice they have lots of pastries from local bakeries, bagels, and even breakfast burritos as food offerings! If I see that the line is short, I'll try to swing by and grab a coffee and food together. Sometimes I'll just walk to the truck on Pine/Sansome since it's a teeny bit faster.

Til next time, Philz! :)
author: Bonnie Z.

description:
Always a fan of Philz! I normally get the Ice Mint Mojito or a lightly sweetened green tea with mint. I tried the avocado toast recently which was good.

This location is cute with ample seating outdoors and indoors. It's always busy so expect a line no matter what, it's just that lunch or 2/3pm are super busy as far as I've noticed. 
 
Some key favorite things about this place: sweet staff, lots of seating, plenty of outlets for users, and amazing drinks.
author: Sofia R.

description:
TIPS
If you want it hot, then tell them "do not air-rate." When they pour the water from high up its not for show. They call it air-rate and it cools down the water. 

The ordering process is different at Philz. You order first, pay second, then wait for your order to be called by the person helping you. 

Bring your own person mug. I bring a 16oz hydroflask and ask them to fill it up. Philz will only share you for a small when you use a personal mug even if it's oversized.
author: Eric E.

description: Silken splendor extra creamy, extra sweet is my go to order when I need to wake up. Great coffee, even better service!
author: Brian W.

description: Wow, just wow. This was an amazing first experience at Philz. The barista was SO nice, and talked with me to make sure I ordered exactly what I wanted! Had the philharmonic with no mint and sub a bit of almond milk (vegan), and it was iced. SO GOOD!!!!!! Cannot wait to go back and try more things from Philz. There was a line, but it's totally worth the short wait.
author: Emily H.

description:
Philz is multiplying around the city faster than rabbits these days, but I couldn't be more excited since we usually stay in FiDi when we visit. 

This location is expectedly super busy in the mornings, but all things considered the staff here moves pretty quick. If I lived here, I'd definitely use the Order Ahead app to save some time but then again my barista was really sweet, which made up for the wait. 

Call me a heathen, but I'm not a fan of the mint mojito. I always stick to the iced ginger snap, which is pretty much my heaven in a cup. If you're a first timer, don't be pressured into the mojito unless you really like mint. Their ecstatic coffee is really superb, too.
author: Kate K.

description: First time trying this place  and I love the concept and the flavor of the Mint Mojito Ice Coffee and the Ginger Snap Iced Coffee. The barista used fresh mint leaves in my coffee and the flavor really came through. Each cup is fresh brewed hot and then poured over ice. Usually iced coffee done this way would dilute too much when ice is added but they have mastered the art of brewing hot coffee strong enough to not be too dilute when poured over ice. I will definitely be back if I'm in the area. There is nothing quite like this in Seattle.
author: Jenny C.

description: Excellent coffee with great variety. Don't go in asking for an American, as I did. They do drip coffee  but it's awesome. I had the Tesora. They are short on the healthy food variety, so i had a bagel which was standard. Table to sit in and out and not too crowded
author: Yoram Y.

description: Yum! Love me that Philz Coffee Mint Mojito. Although I really don't like coffee, I will forever and always drink this coffee. Just so good with the perfect balance of everything. Even though this place may have a line literally out its door, the coffeemakers are patient and super friendly. Yum Philz! So Yum!
author: Michelle L.

description:
What else can I say that you don't know. 
Philz makes it your coffee how you want it. 
I'm glad to be able to take advantage of their training sessions and get free drinks for couple days now. 
Happy that there will be this location as the lines at truck gets pretty long.
author: Margaret W.

description: Great coffee and atmosphere! Absolute go to since I moved to SF. Personal favorite is a medium medium mint mojito
author: Katherine C.

description: We found this Philz Coffee as we were in the Financial District of SF.  The line was long on a Friday morning around 10:30 am.  I ordered an iced mint mojito coffee.  I forget what he had but it was also an iced coffee of some sort.  After ordering with the barista, you pay at the register.  After they make your coffee to order, they call your name.  My iced mint mojito was nicely garnished with mint.  But not only that it had a bunch of mint in the drink under the ice too.  It had a pleasant flavor but I don't get what the hype is all about.  It's just okay.  This place may be popular but I guess it's not my cup of coffee. Apparently they have an order ahead app.  If you want to skip the lines, try that instead.
author: Trina D.

description: Love Philz coffee. This is the best coffee especially the Mint Mojito. Can't get enough of it.  I have tried many locations and I get the same consistent quality, friendly staff and great menu. Great place to chat and relax.
author: Shivaji D.

description: Solid coffee that's not overpriced. Slightly sour, which I tend to like less than most coffee drinkers. Still pretty great. The lines are super long in the morning but aren't that bad. I was about 25 people back and got to the front in about 10 minutes or so.
author: L S.

description: The coffee is fine. Could be stronger. The service can be rude! Servers and cashiers impatient for customers who are unfamiliar. The ambiance is overwhelming. I do not need to hear any music blaring at 9:00 in the morning.
author: Lena R.

description:
I'm not really a coffee person but wanted to try this hip place to see what the fuss is all about. It's a sunny day in SF, so I opt for the iced coffee. It's minty with very smooth blended coffee taste. It's not as sweet as I would expect from a sweet drink which is a big plus. 

Instead of use pre-prepped coffee, the brista makes it fresh so I can still taste the warm coffee. Since they do make a cup at a time, there is a little wait for the coffee. I'm sure it's fine for people who really enjoy their coffee. I wish I'm more of a coffee person so I can appreciate all the other specialty coffee that they offer.
author: Xing M.

description:
