First time visiting Philz.  I usually get my beans from Graffeo, but wanted to try out Philz based on a birthday gift of Philz beans from a co-worker.  I purchased a bag of Silken Splendor as well as a small cup of the same.  I really enjoyed the cup and I'm glad I made a good decision on the purchase.

I look forward to customizing future blends of Silken Splendor with the dark roast beans I get from Graffeo for very special coffee experiences.
author: Bernie B.

description:
ORDER AHEAD AND SKIP THE LINE!!!

I repeat. Order ahead. There is a Philz Coffee, on Market Street, in Fi-Di.... what else do you expect? The lines are always out the door and you can easily spend half an hour here ( good excuse to take that extra long coffee break?) 

The line moves pretty quickly. It's just your typical Philz Coffee shop. For those who haven't been here before, I recommend the Mint Mojito ( Sweet & Creamy)! If you're feeling a little less basic then get the Ecstatic (Sweet & Creamy), Tesora and Philtered Soul!
author: Tram N.

description: The mint mojito coffee is amazing, so refreshing, can't even taste the coffee but definitely feel the caffeine. Great for a warm day in SF!
author: Ranita G.

description:
Finally tried Philz for the first time after hearing so much about them! I had a mint mojito iced coffee and it was AMAZING!!! The only downside is that I don't work or live near a Philz and it will probably be awhile before I will have a cup again. :(

I really like that there were "instructions" for first timers on their chalkboard. Super helpful! =)

Also, the staff were all really friendly!
author: Sylvia V.

description:
This is between 3 and 4 stars. Philz is good, but it's still overrated. Bay Areans worship it like it's the second coming. If it wasn't for its frou-frou hipster pretensions, we wouldn't love it so much. 

Anyway, it was nice the last time I came here because an employee passed out free pastries for everybody. All businesses should do this instead of throwing out pastries at the end of the day.
author: Alecia K.

description: Good and unique variety of flavors. "So Good" and "Philtered Soul" are must try for a fan of light/medium roast coffee. Like the fact that they brew fresh and one cup at a time as per your preference of sugar & cream.
author: Avinash B.

description:
Everything is always over hyped in the US and Philz Coffee is another example.

It's really over priced for what it is and seriously nothing special. The ordering process is a bit odd - you place your order with the barista then go into another line to pay then you wait again to collect your coffee. The last step was noticeably long - especially as the place wasn't at its peak busy period. 

I have no idea why everyone is so excited about Philz. The quality isn't that good and coffee didn't taste that original. Too much hype not enough delivery. Won't be going again.
author: Darryl I.

description:
I'm a newb when it comes to Philz but let me just say, it's seems very overwhelming when you walk in and there is a huge listing of all the different coffees and roasts they have. I was so confused on how to order and was thankful I had an experienced Philz drinker next to me to help me order. I ended up with a ginger snap soy latte (i think that is what it was) but it was iced.  I didn't know if I could ask for it warm or not so I just didn't ask. The baristas work pretty fast and you don't pay them directly, you have to go all the way to the right to pay quickly and then wait for your coffee. After I paid, I realized that they also sold food but it was past the cashier so I didn't see it until after. I think the layout should be flipped so you can choose your food and pay prior to waiting for your coffee, it just makes more sense to my brain that way. 

The coffee was okay but I don't think I'll brave the lines again to grab a brew, I'd rather head to Coffee Cultures.
author: Constance D.

description: Love the handmade style.  Got my Blue Mountain mocha and rescued my morning.  Friendly service and great coffee.
author: Troy T.

description:
This review is solely based off of the awful customer service.
I LOVE philz coffee but the barista was the rudest person ever.
There was nobody in line and no drinks being made so I walked up to the counter and she said I have to wait at ropes until I was called. Total bitch just wanted to act like she had some authority.
author: Kathleen C.

description:
So we all KNOW Philz is the best in the Bay. But did you know that the staff down on Front st. are the best baristas in the Bay? I come here every morning before work to prep and enjoy some Dancing Water. Yes, I originally came for the coffee, but these days I 100% come from the staff. EVERYONE at this location is made of glitters and gold. They are so fast and work so hard, the line is almost always out the door and they manage to crush through it in a matter of minutes. I never have to wait more than 5 for my coffee. They move so fast that most times I don't even have time to unplug my headphones and I miss them calling my order. (sorry guys!) 

I am literally obsessed with this location and all the people here that make it the absolute best way to start my day. I am loyal to Philz because of the experience of this store. SHOUT OUT to all the homies (there are too many of you to name, but you know who you are!) that put on the best pandora stations, make the perfect cup of coffee and helped me clean up that one time I spilled an entire Ether in my lap. Ya'll are the BEST. Brandon, your store is straight fire and I commend you for managing the sweetest and hardest working barista team in town. 

I do have one complaint, YO PHILZ, LET ME TIP ON MY CARD because these cats deserve it and should be rewarded for their epic customer services. That is all. Cheers!
author: Jenna S.

description:
First Philz coffee shop in FiDi!

I'm glad that they are growing and making their coffee readily available where it needs to be.

Colorful and contemporary furniture here.  

They have online ordering so you can pick up your coffee instead of waiting in a long line.

Classic mint Mojito is in my books. Do order up their strong coffee if you need a waker upper!
author: Tiffany D.

description:
Wooo-hoo-hooooooo.... finally, a full store front Philz in FiDi.

Welp, you can't miss it. There's *always* a line, out the door. Expect to wait 15-20 minutes. It's not so bad when you have a co-worker to chat with while you wait. They offer the OrderAhead app, but I just don't think it's the same as having it fresh and *earning* it with a 15-20 minute wait - hah! I will say that the baristas here have made my drink 100% perfect everytime. Can't say that about every store...

Definitely visit this location when you're not in a rush.

Oh! And for those who have never tried Philz and coffee inexperienced...I highly recommended:
Hot drink - tesora, philz way
Cold drink - mint mojito, philz way
author: Stephanie B.

description: Excellent hand crafted coffee made to order. I like the breakdown of selections categorized by dark, medium, light roast or decaf. The descriptions of the flavors in each coffee listed is very helpful.  Coming here makes me feel adventurous, trying new coffees. There is often a line but it moves pretty fast. You order, pay at the cashier and wait for the Barista to call out your order when it's done. They put the sugar and cream in for you which is tricky because I've had my coffee re-made before when there was too much cream. And sometimes it's so noisy that it's hard to hear your drink being called out when it's ready. Otherwise it's good gourmet coffee. $3 for a small and $4 for a large.
author: Lucy L.

description: Philz mint mojito iced coffee: the hype is real! I was looking for a Philz coffee during our walk from Chinatown to Union Square. My GPS steered me wrong so we settled for a nice café nearby. It wasn't until we continued our walk a block down that Philz fell into our laps. I didn't care if I already got my coffee fix. There was only a couple of people ahead of me Saturday afternoon, but my order took a bit to make, but I could tell they were doing what they needed to do. Staff were all friendly and efficient. I actually am a tea drinker and don't like alcoholic mint mojitos but their mint mojito iced coffee was very good. Def a must try!
author: Amanda M.

description:
Philz Coffee on Front St. It's lit. 

I enjoyed a mint mojito today, then spent the later afternoon doing work here. 4PM-6PM the music was LIT. Kudos to whoever is in charge of the music selection. Financial district just got a lot more lively :D Drake, Khelani, etc. :)
author: Lillian N.

description:
As a coffee enthusiast this is one of my favorite places. The philtered soul is my go to roast. 

At all the locations all the workers are extremely friendly. They always let me taste out my drink to make Sure it's roasted to perfection.
author: Nishat K.

description:
I love Philz Coffee!

The Iced Mint Mojito and the Jamaican Blue Mountain Hot/Iced are my favorite!

The service is excellent despite the long-ass lines.  I usually get a Health Cookie  to go with my coffee .  This is the coffee I crave for casual friend meet ups AND Sunday afternoons with boyfriend(s).
author: Fawn M.

description: I'm not a big fan of coffee and I'm not a big fan of mint, so it took a lot to finally convince me to try the Mint Mojito. But I finally gave in. And it was delicious!! Definitely not super minty like I was expecting. It's a subtle yet refreshing hint of mint flavor, and it goes surprisingly well with the coffee. They add in ice so initially, it's cold at the top and hot at the bottom--a very interesting mix of both temperatures and flavors. I love how they get the texture so creamy, and thanks to that subtle hint of mint, it doesn't feel heavy! Level of sweetness can of course be adjusted but mine came out perfectly! Super happy I decided to finally give it a try. Definitely lives up to the hype.
author: Ashley Y.

description:
this may very well be my favourite downtown location of Philz - i mean sure, it helps that there's a tragically handsome barista that works here every morning i come in, and his smile may or may not make my head want to melt, but that aside ... the coffee is excellent and the service is lightning fast.

don't be put off if the line is extending outside of the building (as it so often is in the early morning!) as it is quickly worked through by the staff. i keep telling myself i'll work my way down all of their coffees, but i can't quit that philharmonic maaannng. and the coffees with the mint? all ABOUT that life.
author: Vicki L.

description:
The line to order is more evident than at other Philz locations. You must walk the length of the entire counter to get to the pay register which is located at the far end on the right. There's little chance of mistakenly going directly there to order for first-timers.

They ran out of ice when I got there so I got the Philtered Soul instead. While waiting my barista was apologetic and just as my drink was ready they got new ice. She nicely offered to add ice or make my original drink order. If had more time I'd have stayed but was already there for 15-20 mins...next time I will just order ahead and go there and pick up!

Really my second visit as the first visit during early lunch hour had a line out the door, almost passing their outdoor seating section. Even at after 2:30pm expect a wait - this location just opened!

Note the Mechanics Monument (http://www.yelp.com/biz/donahue-labor-statue-mechanics-monument-san-francisco) is right in front. Good spot to stop by.
author: Peter L.

description: They have a mint mojito coffee here which is one of a kind. Its a delicious beverage, though I don't taste as much coffee in it. They have multiple locations, but protip, if you order your drink in advance, you don't have to wait in line with the masses.
author: Leon K.

description:
I am a Philz Phanatic. 

This location has saved me from falling asleep during the day. (2:30 feeling). You can use Order Ahead to place your order in advance and bypass the line to grab your cup of deliciousness. It's like having a Fast Pass at Disneyland.

If you haven't tried Philz Coffee before, just let your barista know and they will hook you up.
author: Melissa S.

description: Third time trying Philz Coffee and got the mint mojito iced coffee. I opted for skim milk this time and the coffee was definitely not as creamy as it was before when I stayed true to their recipe. The large coffee was $5.50, which is kind of expensive. Even the line was kind of long, I still think the coffee was worth the hype.  If this is your first time in SF, you should definitely check it out!
author: Ariel H.

description:
Similar to the 4th and King Philz location, this one is bigger, has a longer line to order, and more room inside to wait for your drink.  Sometimes it gets so backed up, there's even a line to pay for your drink too.  

If possible, make sure to bring your own cup as you pay the price of a small if it's a large sized cup.  What a deal right?  I found out by accident the other day.  

They still don't have a way to identify what coffee they are sold out of.  I've always wanted to try the Jamaican Blue Mountain but they never have any when I go.  How hard is it to just remove those selections or even put a sign in the ordering area?  

Otherwise, it's convenient for BART and MUNI riders going to work both north and south of Market.
author: Ben H L.

description:
I'm an espresso drinker, but I'd heard a lot about Philz coffee and was eager to try out the new spot that opened on Front and Market in the Financial District.

I expected it be be similar to Peet's or Blue Bottle, but it's not! They only serve drop coffee. If you're a drip coffee fan you'll love this place as you can select the bean that will be individually brewed for you. If you're an espresso drinker you'll most likely be disappointed as its drip coffee!!

The first time I went I had a decent cup of coffee, the next two times were disappointing so I won't be back. The lines are crazy long and I wouldn't stand in one for drip coffee!
author: Emily C.

description: Their mint mojito ice coffee is great, I would definitely recommend ! Staff are really friendly and service is quick! A huge selection of coffees!
author: Anne-Marie R.

description: This doesn't really change how I feel about Philz, but I love the big space and the large amount of seating that's available.  They sell Proper Food salads, and have a great assortment of pastries.  It gets REALLY loud here when there's a ton of people, so hearing your order may definitely be challenging.  I still am mediocre on Philz, but this was encouraging to see in the FiDi.
author: Lisa I.

description: Can not resist the mocha tesora.  This is a particularly chic Philz...the polar opposite of the 24th st. Philz that I usually frequent.  Lots of seating outside..Quite pleasant on a sunny Saturday morning on the way to the Ferry Building farmer's market.
author: Bleep S.

description:
Your good old Philz. What more could be said? Great new large FiDi location, but come at any sane hour and you'll have to battle the yuppies for a spot in line and wait for your Cup of Joe here.

Sure I'd say it is worth it. It's good. It's a cup. We're all addicted, but really if there aren't a lot of baristas and there is no line ... beware. A double edged sword really, but if they're quiet I just don't think the product ends up being made in a manner that's Philz worthy. 

Case in point, I had to fulfill my craving near closing time and the roast was great for that first sip (isn't it always?) because of the rich crema on top, but then after that the true character came out. Burnt, over cooked, no attention paid to because they were roasting me a cup and closing + cleaning at the same time. Just don't do it. Don't serve me a cup of average Joe. Give me a cup of Philz Joe every time please.

I'll make sure not to come at any abnormal and / or less attentaive hour. Thanks for the new location and bright new sign in the new coffee war grounds territory!
author: Joseph L.

description:
At first I thought it was gimmick. But I got instantly hooked. Each one of your orders get individually brewed for your liking is pretty awesome. Yeah get the feeling of being spoiled but that's the idea.

The price is on the expensive side but Starbucks and Peets are similar in price and they don't offer the same type of personal service.

After drinking all the coffee flavors, my favorite is Philtered Soul, extra cream, extra sweet. The hazelnut flavor is a nice soft touch to the palette. 

I'm a fan.
author: Aaron P.

description:
Five stars all the way ... If you are from out of town, go there every day you are in SFO!

They brew each cup of coffee fresh for you, and there are so many varieties to choose from. I selected a mint mojito iced coffee , half sweet, vanilla soymilk. You get your own individual barista, and when she handed me the drink, she encouraged me to try and make sure I liked it. I did try it and said I would like it a little bit more sweet, and she immediately accommodated me. They even put a sprig of mint in each coffee.  It is probably the most unique and delicious cup of coffee I have ever had.

My partner had a light roast strong coffee with soymilk. When he got up to the bar, he heard another person order almond milk, and said out loud that he wished he would've known they had it. Immediately, the barista offered to make his drink again from scratch with almond milk. I can't say that's ever happened to me in a coffee shop before!  And she once again made sure he tasted it and liked it before letting us go.

Everyone was all smiles, and the cashier also asked if we were satisfied with our coffees.

Usually, independent, high-end coffee shops have snooty people working, and some people feel that Starbucks, although their help is friendly, is a too much of a machine. You don't often find outstanding coffee and outstanding service in one place.  Bravo, Philz!!
author: Brian F.

description:
I like my coffee as black as my soul. 

I stop by at Philz probably 5x a week before heading to the office in the morning - I'll admit, I have a coffee addiction, okay!  My go to cup is Philtered Soul sometimes black, sometimes sweet and creamy. Most of the baristas know how to make my drink fucking delicious and I love the chill vibes they have going on. Everyone that I've chatted there are super chill and friendly, and that's why I keep coming back. Despite the long lines in the morning, it's totally worth it. 

Just don't be that douchebag that complains that you're running late and have a meeting to catch and that the long line is holding you back. No one gives a fuck, so calm your shit.
author: Robin M.

description: Great store. Nice management. It would get 5 stars from me if the ordered ahead drinks were made in order. It sucks coming to pickup my drink that's not ready at the one but others that have a pickup time later than mine are done. What's the point of me ordering ahead when I can just wait in line and get a drink faster.
author: Sierra R.

description:
Let me begin--I realize everyone has an idea of what makes their coffee perfect. For me, with a hot drink, I imagine milk that is frothy all the way to the bottom, married with a perfectly pulled espresso, with some sweetness of chocolate or hazelnut or what have you. In an iced drink, I picture a chilled drink that sweats around the clear cup and keeps your hands cool while I sip for hours. 

Now, this is my description of Philz Signature Iced Coffee mocha drink:

Hot. It's as if they imagined the pour-over to be the perfect vehicle for making coffee and just went overboard. Basically, what I have here is a hot pour over with chocolate. Ok, it's luke-warm now that the ice melted. I'm not sure why they asked what kind of milk I wanted in there because the drink is so overwhelmingly COFFEE that the only reason I know chocolate is in there is because it's gritty in my mouth. Speaking of what's in my mouth, there are also coffee beans in the drink. 

The barista was completely nice about my order--I began my experience with a Gingersnap iced coffee, which is basically a hot apple cider coffee. Really, it's gross stuff and I'll never go back. Since there are hardly any pictures of the coffee available on here, this is my coffee: 

I'm calling it the RoomTemp Mouth Exfoliant.
author: S R.

description: I think Philz is my go-to for coffee when I visit the Bay Area... because Mint Mojito.  This location seemed especially optimized for the business rush. And while the store itself was fairly roomy, there were only a few seating options indoors (but there were some tables and chairs directly outside as an option).
author: Eunice G.

description:
Thankful that they opened a Philz in FiDi. When I go to Philz, I usually get there around 8am. The line can vary depending on the day, but I would say the wait is anywhere from 12-20 minutes. Sometimes it can be a bit long, but who can blame them. 

This location does have a pre-order station where you can order ahead from your phone. I looked at it once and the estimated time is about 45 minutes in the morning. If I worked in the area this would be perfect, but since I normally sleep on the Bart I'm never able to get my pre order in :(

I did buy some ground beans there and noticed that this location didn't have their monthly special on lb bags. At their other location they have one type for $14 each month. This gives me an incentive to try their other flavors.
author: Justin Y.

description:
I've been to 9 Philz locations in the Bay Area over a 3 week visit. All the locations are fabulous and some of the best coffee, especially Jacob's Wonderbar. 

Service is top notch and had the great pleasure of being hosted by Mike and Kelly.
author: Kison P.

description: Best coffee hands down! I typically get the silken soul with heavy cream or the Tesora straight up. The barista's are the best and they always make you feel welcome. Not only do they make me the best cup of coffee, they also send me off with their bright smile thank you for being consistent Phil's financial district!
author: Rommel Q.

description: Mint Mojito. Every time. breakfast burritos look really good (and were sold out, which I guess is a good sign). Added to the list. Long line but moves really quickly.
author: Thielson D.

description:
What a place. I used to frequent this spot with my coworkers when sitting in the office seemed utterly uninspiring. Though I don't go as often anymore, this place has cemented itself into my heart forever. 

When going on a Philz outing, I suggest you:

* Order whatever drink sounds the most intriguing 
* Sit outside in the Mechanics Monument Plaza
* Postmates assorted pastries from Mr. Holmes Bakeshop
* Sample all of said pastries
* Talk about funny episodes of Broad City
* Bring a coworker who declines food and drink 
* Contemplate philosophy and what a chair really is
* Absorb as much Vitamin D as humanly possible 
* Find serenity in the ambient sounds of Market Street
* Look up to inspire awe and admire the buildings

Savor each sip, one cup at a time, and tell a friend!
author: Cecelia Y.

description:
The short of it:
- good coffee
- nice alternative to mainstream coffee shops
- order first at the barista then pay at cashier
- open on Memorial Day!
- Favs: mint mojito

The long of it:
I'm late to the Philz Coffee train, I've been visiting SF and it's never been on my radar until recently. So finally I got to try it out! It feels weird ordering a mint mojito at a coffee shop, but this one is not the alcoholic kind...this is a mint mojito coffee. I was very hesitant to order this, I like mint but I'm always worried that the mint flavor will be overpowering. Upon first sip I was amazed. I loved the flavor! The coffee and mint blended so well...it wasn't like anything I've ever had before and I thought it was very refreshing and addicting. We came on Memorial Day and I was worried it wouldn't be open, but luckily it was and there was no line either. Lots of places to sit as well. Overall, wish I had more time to try more items on the menu, but since it looks like they are expanded more in Socal and especially in the OC I may have the opportunity to try it sooner than later.
author: Kristin A.

description:
By far the best coffee in San Francisco, and dare I say, the world? I'm not sure where philz gets their coffee, but it tastes much much stronger than your average drip coffee from your home pot or even a chain like Starbucks. 

The Mint Mojito Iced Coffee is unlike anything I've ever tasted--the perfect combination of sweet, creamy, and minty! I get this every time! 

The Ginger Snap iced coffee is similar to a pumpkin spice latte, but the best part is, it's served year-round. --Definitely a must try. 

The normal coffee at Philz is good, and stronger than your average, but in my mind you go to Philz for the Mint Mojito or Gingersnap Coffee... Unlike anything I've ever tasted from a coffee shop, in the very best of ways.
author: Liz S.

description:
Yes, there is going to be a long line. 
No, you won't regret it. 
Yes, get the Mint Mojito if you don't know what else to get. 
No, you won't regret it. 
Yes, it is expensive. 
No, you won't regret it. 
Yes, you can order ahead. 
No, you won't regret it.
author: Mayra E.

description:
Finally a Philz in the financial district! This one is just as good as the other locations and even better for now because surprisingly there were no lines when I went in the morning. I'm sure that will change though as soon as more people find out about them opening. (UPDATE: yup lines were out the door the next day)

They have tables to sit at both inside and outside. The interior is very spacious and nicely decorated. You order from one of the baristas and then pay at the counter and wait for your drink to be called. The service was really friendly and I could tell they were trying to make sure everyone was happy.

I ordered a small mint mojito iced coffee ($4.50). Very sweet and refreshing. It's my favorite drink of all time and definitely lives up to the hype! I highly recommend getting this if you haven't already.
author: Linda X.

description: Love this place - it's a destination whenever a location is near. The mint mojito iced coffee is a dream.
author: Eileen C.

description:
I have gone here the past two mornings, and I must say I AM HAPPY PHILZ IS HERE! I work in the building across the street, and was hesitant to brave the line the first time I came, however this is now my GO TO SPOT. I usually get a jacob's wonderbar, and I was curious about switching it up. The friendly and upbeat barista (i believe her name is Ana)suggested I try the Tesora, as it is their most popular blend. Simply DIVINE! I can't wait to go through the entire menu, and try them all! Welcome Philz! We are stoked you have arrived! Your coffee makes my day THAT much better.

Oh yeah-the pastrys are delicious.
author: Alicia W.

description:
FINALLY!!! :D

I've been here about 5 times in the past week. The fact that it's a 5 minute walk from my office is so, so dangerous. But it makes me so happy. My favorite drinks: ginger snap iced coffee, ecstatic iced coffee, tesora, and the ever-popular mint mojito.

There's not much seating space in the Philz; it's very much a grab and go type of place for all the office folks nearby. I wish the flow between ordering and paying was a little smoother, since it gets pretty crowded and confusing at the cashier area when you don't know who has paid and who's waiting. Also, note they're only open weekdays.

Side note, they've played some awesome music the few times I've visited, so shoutout to whoever makes those playlists!

I'm soo happy they finally have a location in FiDi now!
author: Alyssa T.

description: I love Philz Almond Milk Mint Mojito Iced Coffee because it's really refreshing tasting!  It's best consumed on a hot summer day.
author: Alice X.

description: First time at this location, but since Philz is never in my area I had to get some. At 9am on a Tuesday you can imagine the hustle and bustle in the SF Financial District, Philz was no different. The location is small with limited seating and the line was out the door with anywhere from 15-20 people in line at a time. From this line I knew it must be worth the wait as no other coffee shop had a line this long! However, the baristas worked quickly and all had a smile on their faces even with the huge crowd. For a coffee lover, must say it was def worth the wait!
author: Amanda Z.

description:
This place is okay. 

I only went here because of the hype that was going around. My expectations after trying this place was disappointing. However, I like how the coffee is brewed to each one. I ordered the mint mojito with sweet and creamy in it. It was just okay to me. I felt like my coffee was bit water down though.

Overall the staff was extremely friendly & I really enjoyed the atmosphere.
author: Helen P.

description: My friend and I both ordered mint mojito iced coffees for our first times and we really enjoyed it!! I liked how you could taste the mint, sweet, and creamy flavors. The line was out the door and the baristas were extremely busy, but this place is the place to be if you want a different kind of iced coffee! Will definitely be back within the next few days!!
author: Juliana P.

description:
I'm a big fan of Philz Coffee, so I was happy to see them expand to the Financial District. The coffee tends to be more dessert-y (kind of like a higher-end Dunkin Donuts), but you can definitely ask for unsweetened or less creamy depending on what you like. It is on the expensive side compared to Starbucks, but they don't charge for extras like almond milk like a lot of other SF coffee shops.

This is a newer location so it doesn't have the "hole in the wall" vibe like the original locations. I recommend using the OrderAhead app to order during the morning rush to skip the wait. Unfortunately this location is weekdays only, but it is open early for those of us who work East Coast hours!
author: Connie Q.

description: An amazing selection of coffee choices, great staff (who clearly love their job), and KILLER coffee mojitos. What more could anyone ask for?  We will be back for sure!
author: Kaleena G.

description: It was a rainy Sunday afternoon and I had just had a sandwich at the Ferry Building. I was going to walk back to Union Square, so I figured why not give Philz a try. It was rated so well, after all. While I thought $4.50 for a large coffee was pretty pricey, I was like a kid in a candy store with so many bean choices to choose from. The barista helped me pick a bold roast, and it was really, really good. I had him put a bit of soy milk in it, and with a splenda as well, it was latte-esque. Very good stuff, and will battle with Blue Bottle for my favorite SF based coffee now.
author: Rob P.

description: Philz never fails to get the job done. Their drinks are deeeeeeelicious! My usual is a TESORA or a CHAI but today I thought I'd try something new... An ICED MOCHA TESORA. HOLY CRAP!!! It was YUMMMMAZING!! This is my new favorite drink!! Oh hipster coffee, you are so good.
author: Bel W.

description:
Totally fine coffee. Coming from the specialty coffee industry myself, it's just a little odd. It's MUCH better coffee and the processes are better than a Starbucks type, but it's really not truly specialty coffee. The single cup "pour over" method they use isn't precise which kind of defeats the reason to do it in the first place. Plus the use of only blends (rather than single origin) isn't the way to bring out the true flavors of coffee. It's a way to make coffee more marketable to more people. Philz does this really well!

All this to say, go here. Get some good coffee. I bet almost everyone will love this place. Just beware if you're looking for a truly exceptional cup of black coffee.
author: Nathan B.

description:
Awesome how they opened a place where there's a high population of coffee drinkers.

Just came back from their opening. I got to take a picture with Phil!! Line was super long, almost out to the curb. Got in line and ladies were coming around with free pastries. OMG pastries are so good. Waited about 20 minutes in line. Ordered a Philtered Soul which took about 5-10 minutes. Wanted it iced but I think the guy didn't hear me, sad.

Definitely will be here for my coffee and pastry fix.
author: Benita M.

description: So excited Philz has finally opened a location in the FiDi. The people here are amazing, the store looks fantastic, and the coffee is amazing as always. I'm sure this store will be great!
author: Makenzi B.

description: Nice having a Philz super close to the office now! This new spot had a soft opening today and is about a 5 minute walk from my office to the front door. I still haven't quite found a flavor that I've called in love with, but I tried the New Manhattan today with a small baklava on the side. The baklava was delicious and the coffee was great too although still a bit strong for my particular taste. I know the place isn't officially opened yet, but it was well run and moving the line fairly quickly. I will mention there was a bit of confusion for the waiting part. It might be good if they designated a place for people to wait because after awhile it was turning into a mad house. I will definitely check this place out again especially after they start selling some food items too!
author: James R.

description: I've been to many Philz locations and while Front St. may not be my go-to, just wanted to take the time to give a shout out to Destiny. Super chill barista that is a proud Philadelphia Flyers fan. Rep your your hood girl and keep up the good work in bettering people's days
author: Aaron C.

description: Soft opening to train the baristas today. Service is spectacular and each cup is made just for you!
author: Ameera D.

description:
Inconsistently good (and not so good).

I've had, by far, my favorite coffee experience at Philz twice. The coffee tasted like something new and delicious to me:) Not coffee so much as creamy divinity. Totally exceeding my high expectations.

Unfortunately, there is no consistency with that deliciousness. I order the exact same thing (Iced Ecstatic, extra cream no sugar), and another barista will pour the hot water so fast, it floats all the coffee grounds and the coffee comes out tasting more like lightly coffee flavored water. Very disappointing. I'm not too concerned about the $4.50 + tip as I am that I walked over to this place and had something delicious in mind.

I am lucky that my first experience was good. More often than not, I am getting a low end coffee experience, and it seems to be happening more frequently with time. I wonder if their rapid growth and/or general busyness has something to do with their diminishing quality assurance.

I finally gave up on Philz. It's too sad knowing what they are capable of serving only to get served something significantly worse (either because a barista is not properly trained or in a rush).

Thank you for those 2 exquisite cups of coffee, Philz :D




P.S. I realize I'm a bit of a coward, as I could probably ask the barista to prep the grounds by lightly wetting them first, letting them sit for a moment, and then pouring the water slowly and evenly over all the grounds, to extract more flavor. They are friendly and nice and would probably try it the way I ask.
author: Sam W.

description:
Love this location of Philz. Literally outside the door of the office.

Honestly, I usually dread going to any Philz location because of the long lines. But the lines are there for good reason, the coffee is sooo good!

I've recently learned about OrderAhead, where I can place my order and just pick up my coffee. It's definitely worth it so I don't have to wait in line, typically in the breezy weather since the line stretches out that long. 

Everyone is always friendly and there are plenty of tables outside in case you want to enjoy your coffee while people watching!
author: Jiki B.

description:
I am no hipster and long lines always intimidated me. However, the proximity to my office had led me here sometimes (and a coworker who will not drink starbucks - what's his problem?).

If you want to be hip, this is the place to be around 8-10 am and then again around 3-4 pm. Long lines out the door. Perfect to show off your sunglasses, outfits, etc. Of course, catch up with your friends during the long wait is another bonus. We all needed a break!

Seriously, yes, coffee is good here. Very smooth and no bitter after taste like you get with the common brew that makes you want to brush your teeth right after. That's why they invented after-coffee mints, just fyi.

However, being the common people that I am a part of, I will continue to go to my usual starbucks (need to earn my stars). Will come here as needed, but so far not a convert yet.

Note to self: Have to try blue bottle just a couple block away...
author: July N.

description: Serioysly the coffee here is worth the wait...Don't come if you don't have the time to drink coffee right. Special thanks to the barista with red hair and fierce makeup who fixed us up!!
author: d v.

description: Philz is a great cheap no frills coffee spot with a ton of coffee selections to pick from. They do everything to order including grinding the beans and doing the drip. You cannot beat fresh coffee, and Philz delivers. The baristas are very friendly, helpful, and happy. Don't come here expecting bar drinks, coffee is all you get. They also have some decent munchies, I really liked the Clover yoghurt!
author: Jonah K.

description:
Surprisingly, this Philz Coffee wasn't crowded at all during lunch time! There was literally no like when I entered which was super convenient. Ordered a coffee to keep me up for work. Waited about a minute until they called my name and took my coffee. Customer service was average. I expected them to do why they needed to do.

Would I come back here? Maybe, just because there are other places to get your coffee.
author: Aj C.

description: Came in at 5am in the morning for a dark roast, which was as advertised. Friendly, helpful service, but ordering process is kinda confusing. Seats aren't too comfortable for lingering around, so it loses a star.
author: Tian B.

description:
I must say I walked into to Philz thinking I was going to be let down by another hyped up place. First, you order from your Baristas who are frantically working with coffee beans trying to start the order of the person before you. Their slogan is "one cup at a time" so you would think brewing one cup of coffee at a time would take some time....before I even paid for my drink my my "ecstatic iced coffee medium medium" was ready! I let the taste of fresh coffee bit my lips and was instantly hooked to this place. 

It isn't only their coffee that makes this place one of a kind, it is the staff who is very knowledgeable about their coffee while at the same time not making you feel like it's a chore to take your order. 

Sad to say it but I will probably be leaving Starbucks behind. I refuse to continue paying 4+ dollars on burnt tasting Starbucks coffee when I can pay 4 flat and get some great tasting coffee that gets the job done! Thanks for opening in the FiDi Philz!
author: Charles D.

description: Ugh, hate the wait... still the Coffee just is perfect.
author: Greg F.

description:
I must say, I absolutely hate hype of all kinds! But Philz...   
...
well... 
it just...
...
lives up to the hype. 

Beware of the bizarre combination of techies and hipsters (and i dislike them both) that philz up this place. The line is always out the door and around the corner, but the coffee??? the coffee??? Is wonderful!!! Who would have thunk' it... Drip coffee has been revived and remixed. They serve drip all sorts of ways. With flavors that consist of: mint, honey, brown sugar, cardamom, nuts, chocolate, blueberry, hazelnut, plum, maple, herbs, caramel, beets (ack!!!), lemon, citrus, cherry, raisin, grapefruit... and the list goes on. So don't let the menu overwhelm you. It overwhelmed me my first time. For me, i finally found my sweet spot with the Philtered Soul that has a hint of hazelnut, cocoa, and syrup. Add a little bit of brown sugar to it and those flavors come right out. 

Yeah, yeah, yeah. I know it can seem a bit froufrou. And I wouldn't advise on spending $4 on a regular drip coffee. So if you're the plain ole coffee type of person, then I recommend that you stick with your Peet's, anti-corporation local spot, or (I dare not mention the devil's company that's taking over the world with their own brand of GMOs) coffee franchise that originated in Seattle, Washington.  

It you're too lazy to doctor your own drip coffee, and don't mind attempting some interesting flavors, and don't mind spending and extra buck or maybe two, then you should try Philz. 

Now... this Philz, in particular has a pretty amazing staff. They're friendly and efficient. I feel bad when they have to scream to get some techie noob with his/her earbuds jammed in their ears listening to some new age blah. So check out the menu and PAY ATTENTION to your baristas. It helps the nearly infinite line move a bit faster. 

The ambiance is unique for a coffee shop. Especially a chain coffee shop. It has a feel of your local spot, with the exception of the lengthy lines and the 3 to 5 baristas making 3 to 5 cups at a time. From what I've read/heard, the sandwiches aren't that bad... as long as you don't mind the gentrified prices.

All and all from what I've seen in my once a week experience for the last few months, they get a nine on a scale from one to ten. 4 and a half stars, but I'll round up since the staff is so friendly. I find that amazing since they're dealing with grumpy faces all morning long. 

Summary:

Great coffee 
Great staff
Great ambiance
Long lines (order ahead)
Fast pace environment
Hipsters and hype feeders will love the place.
author: Stephen G.

description:
This particular storefront is facing Market St. in a little plaza near front, so don't let the address fool you. It's a bit space for a Philz and very lively, especially during the week. Like mot Philz shops popping up, this one is fairly new and they really hustle here. 

If you are visiting SF, staying or coming downtown and haven't had the Philz experience, I would highly recommend trying it out. Hopefully you like your coffee STRONG. If not, they have great teas and pastries, too.

The product is always really good. The service is generally pretty good, but I have noticed that the shine of the initial opening when everyone was bright, friendly and on top of everything has worn off a little. It can be harder to make eye contact with the baristas and they have forgotten a couple of my orders recently and I've had to remind someone about it. Could be the Market St.vibe is rubbing off on them.

Still, I come here at least once every week, and I'll keep coming back.
author: Andrew W.

description:
What can I say that hasn't been said already? This place is my go-to for when I need a pick-me-up or when I want to start my day off with a huge smile on my face or when I want my taste buds to have a happy dance in my mouth. I love PhilZ.

I love their mint mojito - hot OR cold. 
I love the staff! They're always so helpful and friendly! 
I love everything about this place!
author: Stacy V.

description: The coffee is classic Philz. Philz coffee/beverages are great but I just wish there was more seating at this location.
author: Linda L.

description:
I am so so happy with this new location (my wallet is not). 

Pros:
+amazingly nice staff 
+a lot of seating inside and outside 
+coffee quality is still spectacular - 0 complaints 

Cons:
+THE LINES - I work right across the street and NO MATTER WHAT, I will wait 15 - 20 minutes to order, another 5-10 to pay and get my drink. Quite a time commitment to get my favorite cup of coffee, but I'm never sorry that I waited. Slump times usually around 12 and 4pm, according to the barista (not sure I believe it because I have never not seen a line trailing out the door). 
+Music is sometimes reallyyy loud so some baristas have to literally yell your name when your drink is ready (not the typical philz ambiance I feel). 

I will be back (tomorrow).
author: Anu P.

description: Much better than Starbucks and peets. Choosing a coffee can be daunting but I just picked anything and it's usually good and interesting.  A word of warning - a lot of drinks have minty taste because it comes with mint leaves ( or not sure what it is ) so if you don't like mint,ask first before ordering
author: Daniel K.

description: It is hard not to relax at Philz. Comfortable environment, great service and superb location are among a host of strengths to local neighborhood.
author: Michael G.

description:
This downtown location was always packed, at least every time I walked by. However they can handle the crowd and in no time I had my favorite Mint Mojito. Great location since I usually stay in that area when in the city.

Cheers
author: Robert A.

description:
I Love Philz coffee! 

Their baristas are always so smiling and ready to get you the drink you need in the morning. They are very friendly, always smiling and takes the time to ask you how you are doing. Love the experience!

Their coffee is out of this world. Here are my few favorites:

1. Mint Mojito iced coffee (it has a fresh mint on top. Very unique and refreshing)
2. Ecstatic iced coffee (you can request it to be served luke warm instead of iced. They can't do hot)
3. Silken Splendor hot coffee (love it!)
4. Philharmonic (Love it! It comes with a mint on the top and the cardamom flavor is awesome. Served hot.)
5. New Manhattan (I tried it for the first time recently and wasn't a big fan)

They usually ask you the amount of ice/sugar/creme so you can get it however you like it. 

I have tried their spinach croissant and it was delicious!
author: Hiral P.

description: So happy I can order ahead especially when you work in this area. I always get an iced ecstatic extra sweet, extra creamy.. or on some days I get the philtered soul, & the dancing waters!
author: Erika-Kelly C.

description: I'm torn between a 3.5 and a 4 star rating. On one hand this was one of the best cups of coffee I've ever had (Jacob's Wonderbar), the barista was friendly and showed me how things worked as it was my first time, but the line moves incredibly slow and $4.50 is an awful lot to pay for coffee. I most likely will return, but not very often and not anytime soon.
author: Monique J.

description: I usually have a pleasant experience at this Philz as I come here every morning on a daily basis, but this morning was the worst. I ordered an ecstatic, the barista couldn't decipher what drinks were what on the bar so he took a straw stuck it in my drink pulled it out and took a taste. He then grimaced and asked me how could I drink my coffee that way, that's disgusting.  I was very upset at the fact that he tasted my drink then insulted me by how I ordered my drink. I was mortified and will likely stop coming to this Philz.
author: Cat L.

description: Amazing selection of drinks! Been dying to try it out, and when I finally did, it did not disappoint. I got the mint mojito iced coffee, and it tasted so good! The mint wasn't too overpowering, but it gave a little kick that made it that much better!
author: Shawlien K.

description:
Had to try this place out to see if it lives up to all the hype I've heard...

What did I think?... Eh. 

I am a big coffee drinker; have a cup every morning. I usually hit up one of the other chains in the area, but this place always has a line out the door in the mornings, so I thought, "This place must be good!" One morning when I got off of Bart, I noticed the line was short, so I took advantage and tried it out.

Firstly, it was very confusing as to how you're supposed to order and receive your drink. It's not very intuitive to a new customer, but thankfully I got the gist. I ordered randomly from the list; I have no idea which coffee was good because everyone was only raving about the mojito drink on yelp. Since I'm not big on sugary drinks, I was forced to go out on a limb. 

The coffee was honestly like mud. It was so thick and bitter. This is coming from someone who typically drinks coffee with a teeny bit of milk, almost black. I didn't even finish half of my small cup. Waste of $4. 

Their pastries were very expensive too. The ginger scone was obnoxiously sweet and I didn't finish that either. 

Overall, for spending more than $7 on coffee and a scone, I felt genuinely ripped off. It wasn't the best coffee I've ever had, or even coffee that I would try again; the price is just too high for sludge.

Meh. I've had better.
author: Kelly E.

description: What's good Philz its your boy Tony B. Thanks for being one of the few coffee places open early in the financial district. I'm in the area a few times a week super early to take care of a few things. So you need a good coffee to keep your day going. Some days its a wait but since i'm usually and early bird i walk right up and place my order. The staff here is always amazing very chipper in the am. Just like every philz you get the order and then pay and wait for your drink to be called. Simple rules to remember it helps make the lines run smooth. Once you hear them call your drink you taste it to see if it's perfect 99.9 times it is and you move on. I love coming here for the great Mint Mojito. Or i will mix it up and get the so good iced sweet and creamy. Oh yeah  get the coffee of the month for my office.I take back a bag of beans and grind them for my crew. So much easier then trying to bring back a bunch of coffee . If you never had Philz coffee i feel bad for you. Stop in for a treat you won't regret it.
author: Tony B.

description:
Mint Mojito Coffee is a must! Worth every penny!

Ps. Have it creamed instead of sugar or cream with sugar.
author: Vousmevoyez -.

description: Love love love Philz Coffee!!! During my stay in San Francisco I literally had it everyday. I got the Oatmeal Cookie (sweet and creamy), it's on their secret menu. A must try! The baristas were very nice and accommodating as well. Very much a San Francisco vibe. The cafe itself was very nicely decorated as well.
author: Brittany R.

description:
I need to start this review but saying that I LOVE Philz coffee, and seriously seek it out often. Today's experience though made me reconsider returning to this location, even though it's BRAND new and super close to my office. Disclaimer: I have not had my morning coffee yet.

I ordered my usual (Ambrosia, low fat, with light sugar), and took a sip, thinking hmm, this isn't what I usually get, I'll go double check with the barista. I confirmed that there was in fact milk in there, and then she said, "I put in low fat/2% milk." I let her know (politely of course) that I was under the impression that low fat was the mix of cream and non-fat milk (picked up this pro tip from the Philz Truck on Sansome - 5 stars), and she said "oh...you need to order low fat VERSION....not just low fat." Ok, I'm sorry...honest mistake. I was a barista once too, and I would always offer to remake the drink if the customer wasn't happy. Instead, she just added another splash of the same milk to the now overflowing (not to mention HOT) drink, which got all over my hands when I tried to pick it up.  

The coffee still didn't hit the spot, and I ended up tossing it. Which is sad!

I'm over you, Front Street Philz.
author: Laura H.

description:
My 1 star is for this location only. I'm usually a big fan of philz but this location really needs to work on a few things. 

There used to be long lines at this location, and maybe other patrons feels the same way that I do--because it's definitely not as busy as it used to be. 

The baristas are not as friendly as the other locations, but I still came here because I thought the orderahead app was convenient. They messed up my order numerous times and I still came back (is the mint mojito just a mojito coffee if it was missing the mint?) But after having to ditch my order because it still wasnt ready 15 minutes after the stated pick up time. I finally decided to say Byeee Felcia. Bye.
author: Carmen A.

description:
For this location, the line is always long but the service remains excellent with their personable, cheery, chill baristas. If I'm in a pinch I'll use the Order Ahead app and pick up my drink after lunch to crush the oncoming food coma. 

Ecstatic Iced Coffee and pretty much every medium roast blend is epic. I am a Philz coffee addict and I don't even care if its trendy or whatever. It's loved for a reason. So damn good!

Final note, be ready to stay wide-eyed till 1AM - crazy, long-lasting caffeine kick.
author: Amy C.

description:
When I first came here, it was so good that I had to come back and try all the flavors. I didn't think the Tesoro was anything special, but the Ginger Snap and Mint Mojito are truly amazing. I prefer them hot, but they come Iced by default. I also enjoy the Ecstatic and the Hazelnut as well. 

Here's the catch, after coming here everyday for about 2 weeks, i had two bad ones in a row. No problem, I'll take a break, one week later I went back and it was still terrible. Even after adding another spoonful of sugar it was still very bitter (it was the mint mojito too). I'm not sure what happened but my last 3 visits have been misses. I'm hesitant to go back now for fear it won't be good for the 4th time in a row, but the times they got it right it was definitely a 5 star place.
author: Jeff W.

description: An hour before closing -- approached the barista-- she told me to step back in line and wait to be called -- waited 5 minutes with no one in front of me -- also note that on Sunday's they really start locking up and stop taking orders just before 2:30 -- so they could all be out by 3 -- bomb coffee though . Canopy of heaven with muddled mint -- large . So good
author: Alexander T.

description:
Came here 3 days after their grand opening and of course the line was out the door. There has been a lot of hub bub in anticipation of their opening. I'm personally not a coffee drinker (blasphemy!) so I ordered the hot chocolate and just asked them to add some mint leaves in it and it was delicious. The chocolate wasn't syrupy or crappy tasting, it was obviously some quality stuff. 

And given how long the line is, the wait was actually  not half bad. The staff there were super efficient. They were friendly, fast, and got shit done. They even had a person at the beginning of the line guiding you to the next barista as soon as they are free. No time wasted here!

Oh and the best part, you can order ahead and pick it up. If you work around the area, download the EAT24 app and you can order and pay on your phone, just stroll on by, pick it up, and laugh at all the other people in line. done and done.
author: Krystal C.

description:
Great iced coffee (was fun playing compare & contrast with Blue Bottle) and the bacon and cheddar scones were amazing. Seriously, buy like three or four of those if you can.

The iced coffee has a bit of bitterness (which I kinda like) compared to the super smooth iced at BB. Wish I remembered the name of the iced I got, but it was one of their specialities.

There was a protest outside this location on one day we went by, hopefully they are treating construction workers fairly now (??). Not sure what that was all about.
author: Greg M.

description: love Philz in general, i have an affinity for their Mint Mojito coffee :) i treat myself to it (sweet & creamy) at the end of the week if i get the chance. i'm never able to get into this location during the work week, in the mornings, the line drags out the door and into the (smelly) square that the storefront faces. but, if i'm in SoMA during the weekend, i drop by and grab a cup. i just wish the mint were served with less ice and more of the actual drink.
author: Meryam B.

description: Mint Mojito Coffee! Amazing and of my favorite coffees I've ever had the pleasure of trying! I wish this location was open later but I'm just glad I got exactly what I wanted. No espressos, cappucinos or lattes here. Just an array coffees from different regions around the world. The staff was also extremely helpful in helping the boyfriend decide on his afternoon kick as well. Can't wait to go back to san francisco just for this!
author: Linda N.

description:
I love Philz really...my whole family does. But the entire organization needs a lesson in feng shui...does anyone ever really know where to order/buy the coffee?  Always a mess. This place is even worse. I walked 20min from my workplace at a brisk pace to arrive 10min before closing. I arrived and the door was locked! I looked in and a server mouthed "we're closed"...I looked at my watch, I looked at my phone...still 10min early! Wtf? 
This place should be 5 stars based on the product, but jumps way down to 3 for multiple subpar experiences... Get on the stick! Yr now sitting just a half a star above the tenderloin Starbucks!!!
author: tim s.

description: The best coffee in the Bay Area hands down. Try the Mint Mojito or the Silken Splendor.
author: Margaret A.

description:
They have the best freaking pastry ever!!!! Their plain Kouign is the best pastry I've ever tasted.  Have it slightly heated.

Remember the first time you ever ate a warm Krispy Kreme donut fresh from their store...Remember how it melted in your mouth...Well this kicks it and it's mom's butt.  It's a perfect blend of sugar melted in butter held together by some pastry.

Their coffee is great too from what I can see and smell.  I only like Vietnamese Cafe Su Da, so until they make that, I can't rave about it.  For now, I'll stick with the pastries.

Try the plain Kouign....you will love it.
author: Edward M.

description: Their mint mojito is the perfect beverage and now it is super close to work. I managed to get in the soft opening and got a free coffee. Yum. Their official opening date is June 9 2015.
author: Jessica P.

description: I'm not huge on drinking coffee or any type of barista! But I was recommend this place by a friend and was not disappointed. Everyone seem generally happy working there and was really nice. I got the mint mojito ice coffee as suggested by everyone on yelp. It was defiantly refreshing and creamy, I would go back to philz when I'm back in the bay!!
author: Hien N.

description: The customer service here is great! They're so nice. I usually get an ecstatic medium medium and I even came back for a second round after my audition. Nice place! They've got so much traffic in this one - so if you're bringing a laptop ... Be prepared to sit outside.
author: Marevie T.

description:
Was in SF visiting for a few days and this was a recommended place to visit! I tried their iced mojito coffee and it was a refreshing change from the regular flavored iced coffees one gets at any other coffee place!

Customer service is impeccable! I ordered a small iced mojito coffee, they gave me a large because I waited really long for it. And they gave me another one (plus a coupon for a next free drink) because halfway through my first one I discovered a strand of hair in mine! Thank you!!!

The I sat around and people watched. Could've done it all day in that wonderful ambience :)
author: Tammy Y.

description: They have the best coffee and if you like iced coffee you have to try the mint mojito ice coffee.
author: Latrina S.

description: Great coffee. I go here every time I'm in San Francisco because of the atmosphere and the hand poured coffee. They have great flavored coffees and their iced coffee is my favorite.
author: chad w.

description: I had heard about Philz Coffee and their famous Mint Mojito Iced Coffee.  Happened to be in San Francisco for work and stopped by and boy it lived up to the expectations!  The service was also phenomenal!  Staff was super friendly.  I loved the minty, creamy flavor and will definitely be back for more next time I'm in town.  They're expanding and coming to DC as well - can't wait!
author: Cindy Z.

description: Easily the best coffee in the Bay Area! Every location has friendly, fun staff who make an amazing cup of coffee. Is there a wait, of course, but that just means you're not the only one wanting a cup of awesomeness that day. Chill out, wait in line, and get your coffee euphoria on with everyone else. If you want a shorter wait with a mediocre cup of coffee, then attend a Starbucks with the other corporate lemmings!
author: Bradley V.

description:
Philz has some of the best coffee I've ever tasted. I was surprised to see no espresso machine behind the counter. I will say I was a bit confused thinking it was all just drip coffee... but they apparently specialize in pour over coffees (which in general are great already, but mix pour overs with their amazing coffee bean blends... PERFECTION.) 

I highly recommend this place for all you coffee lovers out there. 

Came in this morning looking for a good cup of coffee & left overly satisfied. Well done Philz. Well done. 

Ps. Code 33 is the way to go. It won't disappoint.
author: Madeline G.

description: Favorite coffee, hands down.  So glad they added a brick and mortar location in FiDi.  Hope they add more locations, as the line is always ridiculous, regardless of the time of day you go it seems.  Don't get me wrong - it's worth the wait...  But I'd probably stop in more often if I knew it was a shorter wait-time...particularly during the work week.
author: Rachael S.

description: got to have Philz when your out here. always consistently good and wonderful workers.
author: Jay M.

description:
Loved the coffee. Hate the process.  A long line to order then, Another long line to pay.

Had the Ecastic iced coffe, the mint iced coffee and the Ether hot coffee.

Next time I'll know to say small iced Ecastic medium cream no sweet, cause I wasn't sure when ordering what to do.

Today at about 10 am on a Saturday, the line was only about ten deep.  I can't imagine what it's like on a week day when the line is around the corner.
author: Foodlover B.

description: My wife and I were on our way to union square when we found this gem. We're not from the city so we had never heard of Phil'z, but are we glad we walked in! This place is excellent. The atmosphere is warm and clean and the workers are extremely helpful and friendly. The hot chocolate is DELICIOUS and I'm sure all of the food there is superb!
author: Alex L.

description: Delicious coffee. Had the iced mint mojito and it did not disappoint, definitely a once in a while treat and not an everyday coffee. Wish we had Philz on the East Coast.
author: Cara S.

description: The Mint Mojito was bomb!! The Barista was awesome, welcoming, and explained everything with a smile. I didn't feel rushed it felt relaxed and laid back.
author: Denette C.

description:
Been going to Philz for years and this location is so inconsistent. Today alone I had my coffee made twice because each time it was warm water and they tried to explain to me it's because of using cream (I've been using creamer for years). If your coffee isn't burning your mouth then something is wrong and at $5 a cup I would expect a GOOD cup of coffee. When using order ahead it's even worse you never know if it will be on time. Sometimes they make it about 10-15 minute in advance which at that point it's cold or they make it 10 late. 

The store manager is really nice, however this review was overdue.
author: Fara A.

description:
No sense of urgency which is really disappointing of a business located in the financial district. The baristas continuously looked over at the building line without saying anything, no indication of when they'll be taking the orders. Very disappointing as this was my first time testing out this location. I'd always go to the one on Castro if I have the time. 
The interior is bigger than the other Philz I've been to and a lot nicer. I just never sit and chill at a coffee shop so it's not really important to me. Perhaps because this location was designed for a longer stay that the staff don't feel the need to provide speedy service. Not exactly the place to be if you're in a hurry.
author: Julia N.

description:
Besides the always delicious coffee, my favorite thing about Philz is their use of individual pour-overs for each cup. This method does take some more time but it's well worth the commitment. The way they make their coffee is simple (just cream and sugar - with a few 'fancy' drinks if you want), and they have so many roasts to choose from; it's a great place to learn about how roasting can affect coffee. 

My favorite is the Tantalizing Turkish with light sugar and cream, I love dark spicy roasts, and the mint sprig adds a lovely touch of flavor. Another go-to on a hot day is the Iced Mint Mojito (which they can make hot too!). I've always had a great experience with kind staff and will always come back - especially if I bring my Philz travel mug for a discount!
author: Elizabeth W.

description: So the line was a bit intimidating at first glance, but because our friend recommended it to us during our visit to SF, we knew we had to do it. Let me tell you, it was well worth the wait. We ordered two iced coffees with almond milk and the blend was just delicious. All of us absolutely loved our drinks and are still talking about how great the coffee is.
author: Abigail H.

description: This is my favorite coffee shop ever! Love Philz... You can't go wrong with the mint mojito but for a special treat try the Jamaican Blue Mountain. It's worth every penny! Highly recommend iced!
author: Laura B.

description:
Always a pleasure to grab a cup of joe from Philz. The Front street location is usually pretty busy; a good way to get around this is to use the Order Ahead app as there is a separate pick up area. My go-to is the dark blend,  Ether. I've picked up coffee here several times and I am yet to be disappointed.

What probably makes the difference here is the aeration process they follow when they brew a coffee. Just guessing, but whatever it is, it makes my day every time.
author: Vijay K.

description: I was very happy when a Philz opened up in the financial district with expanded hours compared to the truck. I think the key is to use the app order ahead!! Skip the line, pay online, and come when the coffee is ready! The only problem is that it can take quite a while (30-45 min) 'til the pickup time, but as long as you know that possibility ahead of time, I think it's all right.
author: Lisa K.

description:
A real San Francisco treat in the heart of the financial district.  An afternoon break with good friends at work in a blustery day to have a nice coffee blend made for you one cup at a time.

I have moved from one coffee establishment to the next and this currently is my favorite.  Great tasting coffee that does not upset your stomach is grade A to me.

Suggest though that you use order ahead app as lines can be long.
author: Fe R.

description:
meh.  Its a good cup of coffee.  Unique blends, and WAY better than stuff like Starburnt and Peets.  With that said, I used to love going to Philz, especially with the order ahead feature (I hate standing in line for something as simple as coffee).  Baristas are nice, friendly, accommodating, etc.  Service is usually fairly quick.  But they can be inconsistent.

All that said...$4.50 for a large cup of coffee?? Really?  It was bad enough when it was $4.  But then, apparently overnight, they raised the price over 12%?  I'm sorry, aren't you expanding your brand aggressively after receiving a large influx of investment capital?  Where is the supposed economies of scale that should be coming with buying and producing more and more cups of coffee?  Did the prices of your beans really go up that much?

Philz was hyped like no other, and are now taking advantage of it.  What used to be a quick pick up while on the go or a nice outing a couple times a week with coworkers is now a once a month treat, max.  If you were to go to Philz 5 days a week and order a large coffee, that's $22.50 a week, before tip or any splurge on food.  

Seriously Philz?? For Coffee??  No thanks.
author: T. G.

description: I got the mint mojito and It's definitely one of the most refreshing iced coffee drinks that I've ever had. It was 11 but the place was still busy. That being said, I think it took 5-10 mins max from the moment I lined up to when my coffee came out. I would definitely come here every week I lived in San Francisco.
author: Sarah L.

description:
I love Philz coffee and this location is no different from the others, except for the ridiculous lines. 

I came here for their employee trainings and after they officially opened. It's always consistent, good service. Everyone is super friendly and nice. 

Drinks are always on point. They ask you to taste it before you go so you walk away happy. If you choose not to do so, and are unhappy, that's really your own fault. 

Mint Mojitos have my heart forever, but even their other coffees are really good, like Philtered Soul. 

Yum!
author: Jeannie L.

description:
I always thought Blu bottle is waaay overrated, but this coffee right here is justified!
Quick tip always order ahead because the line is waaay too long, and I got things to do.
The price is a little steep but, I must admit once I went back to Starbucks I will pay the extra 75 scent for something delicious! 
Just me writing this review makes me crave my favorite code 33.
Cool vibe outside if you just want to chill and converse. The only con is that line... my lord that line can really set you back. Always order ahead or go around lunch hour.
author: Dwayne A.

description:
Awesome. Love the mint mojito. 

Order a 20oz. 

Also it's probably time for philz to open more locations in the financial district.
author: Mack L.

description: I love Philz Coffee. I went here around 530am and there was no line, considering the sun hasn't come up yet. I order a mint mojito with soymilk. I LOVE how there is no extra charge for soymilk, considering other places do charge for it. The service was very friendly and welcoming. You can also use OrderAhead to avoid the long lines during rush hours especially when people are going to work, for lunch or when going home. I would definitely come back here. The artwork displayed on the walls are perfect too, very well done!
author: Loree T.

description:
Philz on Market? Yes please! I am sooo happy to hear there is a Philz about two blocks away from my work. NGL, I can get philz almost everyday. They built this location fairly quickly and even when there is a long line.. it goes by pretty fast! I usually do OrderAhead and they have never failed on my drink and it's ALWAYS there when I go and pick it up. I've had it where my order wasn't even ready yet by the pick up time but this place is always on time! 

I think one con I would have to say is.. that in one of my drinks, there was a tinyyyy piece of plastic in it :( BUT either way.. going to give them 5 stars because I won't lie... that isn't going to stop me from coming here again.
author: Krystal O.

description: Overpriced and kind of meh... I did not appreciate the pretentious barista that took my order, I'm sorry that I don't know what "light, medium, or sweet" means regarding my mocha. I politely asked for her to explain and did not get a very polite response. In my opinion, that's like a Starbucks barista getting mad when you ask for a medium rather than a grande. This was my third poor Philz experience. First two times I had amazing service but I don't like hot coffee poured over ice...just turns into a lukewarm mess.
author: Amanda C.

description:
Coffee is coffee, right?  Not when it's specialized gourmet coffee that you would spend some bucks on.  I already knew that our grandparents' day of coffee for 10 cents and a pot for 15 cents were gone when Starbucks began popping up its franchise around town, but now we have a specialized, gourmet style drip coffee business. 

Similar to Blue Bottle but with stores, Philz has expensive coffee ($3 for a small one) and a variety of teas and drinks.  When I walked into the new Front Street store, a former First National Bank, I noticed the pictures and posters were very San Francisco, complete with colored benches and places to plug in your laptops and meet the lunchtime crowds.  

The barristers were friendly enough.  You wait in a very long line (it was lunchtime though) and get called over a long counter.  You give your order, which coffee has many different styles and flavors, and they'll even add cream and sugar!  The actual wait is short, but $3 a cup is a bit much. 

Pros:

Great ambiance and service.  Coffee not bitter like Starbucks but not as smooth as Peets.   Great selections. 

Cons:

High priced coffee, and not even a coffee sleeve to protect your delicate fingers.

***

Also the Front Street store has funky decor outside, complete with chairs and tables. 

It's more hype than substance.  Good for a quick one but not if you are on a budget.
author: James M.

description: The service was good and the woman at the front was delightful and helpful. She explained me about their special style coffee making process and it was interesting.  The coffee itself  was decent but not amazing but still the whole experience was pleasent.
author: Ori M.

description:
Life just get so much better working here.

They are pretty fast. I was in and out in 5 mins this morning. You can also download an app called Order Ahead to order ahead then pick up later.

Must try mint mojito and Jacob's wonderbar.
author: Vivi C.

description:
Oh my god.. This coffee is amazing. I even considered going there twice every day. My husband enjoyed the "philz way" and I happily ordered the favorite "mint mojito". The customer service is amazing and they were extremely helpful in explaining the way things work at philz. 

Wish they had philz in Canada!!!
author: Courtney J.

description: Had a fantastic morning here with some friends on vacation. The customer service here was incredible, and Charles was AWESOME. Thanks Charles!
author: Ryan B.

description:
I have to add another star even though this spot fails to acknowledge their customers in this immediate area on the weekends which was why the initial review and rating.

So why the add a star?  

Their weekend closure enabled me to locate the Blue Bottle spot a couple of blocks away.  Thank you Phiz Coffee!
author: Terrence P.

description:
Yum, so delicious. Was there a long line: yes. Was it worth it: definitely. 

Pro tip: pre-order and pay, then just pick up your drink and skip the line!
author: Alison Y.

description: Philz Coffee has got me addicted. Love the style they make your coffee, with cream and sugar. This Tesora coffee literally wakes you up. Five Stars from this coffee lover.
author: Sadath S.

description:
Thank you Philz for opening in FiDi!

I've had it before but never actually went to the shop to get it. My first experience with ordering was yesterday and The barista (and the menu/chalkboard) was super helpful in the sequence of things. I was also very impressed with being presented with my drink and told to try it before leaving in case it wasn't to my liking. I think that's awesome. I'm in trouble if I ever decide not to live in the bay area!

Wish Philz was on every corner instead of Starbucks!
author: Taryn C.

description: Only downside is it makes it difficult to switch back to Starbucks during the week. Favorite is the ecstatic ice coffee with cream.
author: Phillip H.

description: For the folks at the order ahead counter this morning (5/11/16). I made a technical error, but you had my back in my time of need (before 8AM on a weekday, no coffee in hand).  Thanks for your help and kindness!
author: Jennifer W.

description: This specific philz coffee is not on par as the other ones I've tried. Seems to me that since they're opening up so many new locations they're losing their touch since the quality isn't top notch like the first time I've had it. Service was excellent though, but I'm giving this location two stars because of the quality of my iced mint mojito coffee. First time I received it the coffee was too bitter for my liking (definitely didn't taste like how it normally does), so I had them remake it with extra sweetener.. At first it was good for the first two sips but then I noticed for the rest of my duration drinking it, my favorite iced coffee was watered down :( and still not we sweet as I desired. By the time I realized it, it was too late :((
author: Kimberly P.

description: Best coffee I've ever had! The iced mojito was amazing. So glad its by my apartment, I'll definitely be here everyday.
author: Christine T.

description: Great pour over coffee. Line is permanent. But tends to move semi fast. Must try mojito coffee. :)
author: D P.

description: The mint mojito iced coffee. You either hate it or you love it, but I definitely love it. The only reason this is 4 stars is because it's a little on the pricey side, so I can only spoil myself a few times a week.
author: Corey H.

description: Coffee is good; service is really, really bad. It never helps to forget your customers.
author: Mark H.

description: There are few good times to play DMX, and at a coffee shop is not one.  Went there for the kouign amann.  Was disappointed.  It was about the size of a silver dollar, and so-so in taste. Lot's of variety of coffee, but the ordering system is inefficient so unnecessary waiting is involved.
author: Scott P.

description: I NEVER drink coffee in the middle of the day but decided to grab an iced mojito coffee yesterday...mind meltingly delicious. Good call. It made my day! Seriously! And all the women working there were very nice and helpful. Awesome place!
author: Monica C.

description: While I love philz this was quite an unpleasant experience. I am typing as I am sitting here with my husband and 72 year old mom! After we purchase our 3 coffees they were about to close my mom asked to use the restroom which was blocked off. A woman in a grey bulls t shirt told my mom "No we are closed"! I could not believe it. It pains me to write a a bad review however I was appalled! We purchased coffee and were not coming off the street! The cute Asian barista and a handsome I believe Asian man helped us and made my moms first philz experience awesome! However the girl maybe Latin with curly hair and bulls shirt needs to learn the meaning of customer service!
author: Sabrina M.

description: I have a love-hate relationship with Philz. One side of me enjoys the local charm and variety the company provides for the SF coffee scene. The other side of me realizes I'm just another techie dronebot waiting mindlessly in line for an overpriced cup of sugary joe. Who's right? Who's wrong? All I know is that the red haze (off-menu) is the way to go!
author: Erich G.

description: Maybe the friendliest baristas ever here. Bought a bag of the Tantalizing Turkish beans and they offered me some mint leaves for my brew! This is my new home store.
author: Karl K.

description: No less than 5 stars. I'd give them 10 if I could. The mint mojito is amazing!! Best coffee ever!
