My only wish is that they would open one in the east bay...in Livermore...with a drive thru. Wishful thinking. I love this place, I love the friendly amazing staff, and I love their mint mojito!!!
author: Bonnie H.

description: I was trying to get a croissant and they told me to go to the snack area. When I went there the staff told me to go back to the ordering area. Then the ordering area people told me to go to the snack area. Bad service! If you want to relax and grab a coffee or snack, make sure you find a better place.
author: Feng G.

description: Love this place pricey ice coffee but very good there are usually long lines but I love using the App to pre order before I get here
author: Jim E.

description: Spare me your long lines. Spare me your prententious attitude. Spare me your prices. Spare me your massaging my coffee beans...or, whatever. C'mon it's coffee, get over yourselves.
author: A J.

description: so yummm! wish the wait was shorter. but so yumm!
author: Christina L.

description:
love this location! everyone so nice and frendly :)
mojito coffee is a must try!!!
author: Miffy L.

description: Someone from Philz contacted me and sent a gift card to make up for the ill prepared beverage! I've been back a few times and I've had delicious drinks ever since.
author: Taylor K.

description: Like how Philz respects the tradition of the bean. As a first time visitor, I was overwhelmed with how I was supposed to order and separate ordering station for food and then a separate location to pay. There is a whole lot of good happening at Philz but perhaps a little coffee clarity would even make it better.
author: Marnie C.

description: Skip the line and head to the truck on Sansome Street if you can. There's always a long line at this store that moves very slowly. Kind of tells you about the inefficient baristas inside. They always mess up your pricey mint mojito and are cheap on their mint and sugar portions. This would be my last time in this store. Again go to the truck for the real flavor and drink. A little walk is even worth the quality of the drinks.
author: Rabab M.

description: I'm not one for coffee, generally, but my girlfriend wanted to try something new. We got the Mocha Tesora and the Mint Mojito coffee (hot and iced respectively). Both of these drinks were excellent, and I wouldn't hesitate to get them again.
author: Aaron M.

description: It's Philz coffee, what else am I supposed to say? Their mint mojito iced coffee is great, call me basic but that's really all I get there and it never fails. This new location right off market street is convenient and spacious. The nice entrance/plaza right outside is a great/ideal place to enjoy this Silicon Valley-hipster-cup-of-joe.
author: Bradley C.

description: I am not impressed. I will not wait 20 minutes for a drip coffee that is just ok. Spent most of that time standing in a line that didn't move. Then people who came in after me started picking up their drinks before me.  It's not like they had a more complicated drink...it's all drip coffee. I'm obviously not their target customer.
author: Kathy C.

description: Philz really just makes the world go round. They only DO NOT do espresso drinks, rather the focus is on making simply the best drip coffee you'll ever taste. I used to work in coffee and know that even with the best beans and roast, your coffee can be ruined in the brewing process (if the water is too hot, the beans have been exposed to air/ light, wrong grind, uneven ratio etc etc etc). Philz baristas eliminate these potential problems, as all are trained in what it takes to make the freshest cup.
author: Vee S.

description: The coffee is legendary, no flaw to report whatsoever!  Staff is for the most part pretty nice, Brandon the manager especially kind.
author: Alee Z.

description: Came in on Friday afternoon (today) and the barista broke my cup. Did not apologize. Did not offer to replace my broken glass bottle. Thanks, guy. Buyers, beware bringing your own cups!
author: Lia T.

description: I love Philz. There's really nothing more to it. This location always seems to be popular though - so beware of lines. Thankfully the service is fantastic and totally makes up for having to wait in line :)
author: Teresa C.

description: I've loved Philz for a long long time. We even get the beans to brew the coffee at home every morning. The coffee is pretty strong, so I usually get half caf - absolute favorites being Swiss Water with Philtered Soul, no sugar, unsweetened soy. They shake it up so well that it almost has the texture of a latte.
author: Grace W.

description:
Mint Mojito coffee. Every time amazing. Always excellent service. This is a must visit for locals and visitors alike.

I miss this place the most of anywhere from my time in the Bay Area.
author: J W.

description: Another taste of coffee. More interesting and full. Highly recommended. Relax and drink. Happy Holidays!
author: Vadim R.

description: I never fancied myself a "coffee expert" until I had Philz...now I know the difference between good and GREAT coffee. I will avoid nearby competitors whenever possible now. ONLY downfall is that their popularity means ridiculous lines out the door. If you download the OrderAhead app on your phone you can order your coffee and avoid the lines...but you're still talking waits of 30-60 mins at peak times.
author: Maria S.

description: I come here every morning at 5:30. No lines. Coffee is amazing - prefer dark roast - Jacobs black. Barista's are friendly and know how to make coffee. Once you go to Philz you will never go anywhere else!
author: Robert B.

description: This place is a buhhhhh-lessss-ing!! Philz truck was just not cutting it. Now there's this huge af Philz off of Front with a line that goes nearly out the street. Use the OrderAhead app to get in and get out witcho coffee fo dat ass.
author: Jo L.

description: Coffee is very smooth and I love the mint mojito coffee!!! Only complain is that the seating is not great.
author: Kathy Z.

description:
You know the old joke about the mechanic who says, "fast, good, cheap; pick two out of three"?  Well at Philz you get 1 out of three....maybe.  Cup of coffee and a breakfast sandwich is 10 bucks. Coffee alone is 3 for a small.  You gotta be kidding. It's just not that good. 

Given the lines it is also slow normally, but I was there a little after 6am and it was definitely slower than any Starbucks. 

Finally, while the quality is fine, the size of the sandwich is subpar, especially for the price. 

Definitely not worth the price or the wait.
author: David G.

description: So happy there is a Philz at this location, close to my office! The lines are normally very long but move (relatively) fast. Love the gingersnap iced coffee. There's a great outdoor space to sit and enjoy your coffee as well. Also, the staff is very, very friendly and helpful.
author: Ana D.

description: Went there for the first time, got the opportunity of getting Faith as my Barista. Told her im a fan of a chai, she perfected it to my capability n taste without having me to look at their extensive selection. Faith n her staff are a friendly bunch and create a good atmosphere!
author: Pritesh W.

description: I was skeptical. I saw the line extending put the door. Who is this fill and what is making these people stand in line 45mins for a cup of coffee. What kind of job lets you take that type of break. I had to experience. And to my avail, had an hour to put into the effort.  First, who knew there were 20 different types of coffee. Each detailed description of tastes such as nutty, fruity, hint of chocolate. I closed my eyes and picked one. Indeed, the taste of the coffee was very accurate. Coffee was very tasty. But the verdict is still out on the worth of 30-45 minute wait. 10 minute wait, then goodbye gold member Starbucks.
author: Victor B.

description: Line is a little long in the morning as it is with every other coffee shop in the neighborhood. However, the baristas are always cheerful and helpful. Coffee is fantastic of course!
author: Evelyn Q.

description: First time to this place.  Their menu looks very creative.  I tried the popular Mint Mojito Iced Coffee with sugar and cream.  I added some extra sugar, since I like my iced coffee sweet.  The drink tasted great.  The ambiance is fantastic and the lady there told us "taste it and let me know if you want me to make any changes.  I am here to do that for you guys".  I thought that's the next level to awesome customer service.  I will visit this place again very soon.  Just be prepared for long lines...haha
author: Ani R.

description: Love the straight forward, individual cup of coffee.  The bet way to say it, it's a coffee drinkers, coffee shop.  Be prepared to wait as they make each cup as you order.  Staff is friendly and ready to work. Space is bright and has large outdoors seating area.
author: David C.

description:
Come here to study before work because I love the ambiance and I love the coffee. My favorites so far are the Silken splendor, El Tesora, and Mint mojito (of course). I LOVE that you can customize your drink with the level of creaminess, sweetness, and what type of milk/cream/soy/almond or sweetener/honey/etc. 

When they give you your order they usually ask you to try it and see if you want them to adjust the drink for you. That's pretty great customer service.

When you go at prime time, expect a wait for your drink. I think it's worth it. My tip? Get the OrderAhead app - although be realistic if you're trying to use the app at peak coffee break times - it still will make you wait if you don't give them enough time. 
Bonus points for ample outside seating for chillage/studying/pondering life/etc.
author: Tommy W.

description: Don't make it to the city that often so when I went today, I was pleased to see a new Philz near my BART stop.  Line was out the door but it moved quickly.  Coffee was decent but the service was very good and the smiling people making the coffee was a welcome departure from places like Starbucks.
author: Jonathan A.

description: Another beautiful philz!! Made it today for the soft opening. Despite the super long line, the wait was not as bad as it seemed. The interior of the store is super beautiful but much smaller than many of the other philz. It's in a really central location, so I'm sure they will get tons of traffic. Can't wait to come again soon!
author: Charissa L.

description: First time experience at a Philz joint and it was amazing! Barista made me a "Canopy of Heaven" on ice that was brewed to perfection. Two other employees gushed over my daughter and gave her a cookie to enjoy (which she absolutely did) with her juice. Will definitely be a patron at Philz Coffee again!
author: Nuri H.

description: Delicious coffee. However the line is beyond ridiculous. I won't guess what the wait is, because when you're waiting in line, your time perception is warped. I feel like it's under a half hour. Probably 10 minutes or so. It's poor business management to be open Monday-Friday when you can't satisfy the need. There is an obvious need to be open 7 days a week. But yeah, the coffee is worth the wait, on my days off, which are Mondays and Tuesdays. Work days, they absolutely lose my business. I cannot be absent from work that long.
author: Richard V.

description: Best iced coffee I've ever had. Seriously, BANGIN. I was here a week ago and I still remember how great that coffee was. I hear the mint mojito is the move but for real just the basic iced is a winner. I got love for Philz. Never forget
author: Brandon C.

description: Love this place, but the line is always so long. No worries, once you take a sip, you'll know it was all worth the wait!
author: Jules C.

description: I've never been super picky about my coffee until I tried Philz coffee. Now I can't accept anything else. They make the best coffee in town, hands down. Also, a beautiful store and location. Fast Wifi also a plus. I highly recommend Philz to anyone wanting the best cup of coffee they have ever tried.
author: Sandra M.

description: It'z the best is still one of the best cups of coffee I've had. This location is great because it has a lot of outdoor seating and the employees are very friendly.
author: Hi T.

description: I am a long-time Philz customer and started drinking their coffee way before they have become so popular. Sadly, quality has gone down as their business expands. I think it's another classic case of great things ruined by hipsters/hype. Before, their coffee had always been spot on and consistently awesome. Now, especially with this Front St location, the quality is mediocre, if not poor. Philz has fallen to a new low this morning when I got a super rude barista who had major attitude. I usually use Order Ahead to skip the line but Philz wasn't accepting orders through the app this morning so I had to wait in line. The barista I had the misfortune of encountering practically barked at me. He did not give me any greetings, barked "what do you want", never asked how much cream and sugar I wanted etc. When my coffee was ready, he did not call out my order but just let it sit there. When I took the initiative to ask if the coffee sitting on the counter was mine, he was like yeah and turned away, busy getting back into chit-chatting with his coworker. Unlike the usual Philz fashion where all the barista are always friendly and polite, always be sure to check if the coffee is to the customer's liking, this batista did none of that and was simply awful. The coffee he made was horrible too. I hope I would never see him again.
author: Nerdy P.

description: Philz is love.  Philz is life.  The Iced Mint Mojito Coffee may be the best coffee drink I've ever tasted, and this location makes the best version of it of all Philz locations I've been to.  If you've never tried it, do yourself a favor and order one immediately - it will change your life.  It's the perfect mix of exotic, sweet, and savory flavors.  If you go during non-peak hours, the lines aren't too bad either.  Philz is growing really fast and opening new stores every month, so I hope that as they grow they'll maintain their quality and service.  All that said, Philz has been and will continue to be my favorite coffee shop in the SF Bay Area.
author: Zach S.

description: best ice coffee ever! i bring my big thermos but only pay for the price of a small. this place's estactic ice coffee is wayyyyyyy better than starbucks.
author: Tiffany S.

description: The baristas are super friendly even though they have such long lines to deal with :-) The coffee and the service is worth the wait! Knocking off one star for the confusion over where to stand and pay during the morning rush after you have placed your order...
author: Zara Y.

description:
I just went to their soft opening where they were giving out complimentary drinks and pastries. Anyways, the staff guys who were guiding people in front of the line were extremely nice and enthusiastic, and they said repeatedly that I could order whatever I wanted off the menu and however many drinks I wanted; this was great because I was going to order another drink my co-worker. However when I tried ordering two drinks, the girl who was taking my order refused to give me more than one drink, even chastising me on how I was being unfair to everyone else for asking for more than one drink. Despite telling her that the other staff said I could order however many drinks I wanted, instead of doing the logical thing and checking in with another staff or her manager, she just kept standing there saying no - rather rudely too. Despite what I said, she wouldn't listen and kept saying the same thing, how I was being "unfair to others" for trying to order more than 1 drink. 

Please don't tell your customers they can order as much as they'd like and then scold them for doing so. It leaves a bad impression of your customer service and shows the lack of communication between the staff. I get it, it's free but that still doesn't give your staff the right to lecture a customer and call them "unfair" for trying to use a service they were supposedly being offered. Afterwards, I even saw several people walk out with two or more drinks in their hands. 

I am insulted! After this incident I don't think I will be going back there for a while because I don't want to take the chance and encounter that same rude employee again.

Other than that, the coffee was delicious. Thumbs up for their drinks as well as the nice staff - except for the girl who served me. Double thumbs down for her.
author: Heather L.

description: My building is just across this location.  Heard so much about it.  Sadly, all hype in my opinion.  Very  long wait. If you have a lot of time to waste for a cup of coffee, go ahead and line up.   Not a fan.
author: Cj P.

description: Atrocious coffee period. Sure the process of an individual pour-over is nice, but the coffee isn't good. If I wanted horrible coffee, I could have gone to Peets or Starbucks. I will continue to wait for a great cup of coffee at Blue Bottle.
author: H S.

description: Daniel makes THE BEST Fresh Mint Chai i've ever had. Plus excellent customer service. That's why 5 stars. Thanks Daniel!
author: Katy M.

description: Don't really get why people love this place. Coffee isn't very good, pricey and bad service. I never feel comfortable ordering due to the bad service. I would rather get a latte or something from somewhere I feel comfortable
author: Greg L.

description: Excellent cup of coffee! Each cup is a pour-over. Made to order; just the way you want it. We tried Jacob's Wonderbar. You must try it!
author: Robyn P.
